ai-an3:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an3:1.2.1_0: “Whatever dangers there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-an3:1.2.2_0: Whatever perils there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-an3:1.2.3_0: Whatever hazards there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-an3:1.2.4_0: It’s like a fire that spreads from a hut made of reeds or grass, and burns down even a bungalow, plastered inside and out, draft-free, with latches fastened and windows shuttered.
ai-an3:1.2.5_0: In the same way, whatever dangers there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-an3:1.2.6_0: Whatever perils there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-an3:1.2.7_0: Whatever hazards there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-an3:1.3.1_0: So, the fool is dangerous, but the astute person is safe.
ai-an3:1.3.2_0: The fool, who lacks attachment, but the astute
ai-an3:1.3.3_0: The fool is hazardous, but the astute person is not.
ai-an3:1.3.4_0: There’s no peril regarding the astute, no danger, and threat.
ai-an3:1.4.1_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an3:1.4.2_0: ‘We will reject the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’
ai-an3:2.1.1_0: “A fool is characterized by their deeds; an astute person is characterized by their deeds. And wisdom is evident in its outcome.
ai-an3:2.1.2_0: A fool is known by three things.
ai-an3:2.1.4_0: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:2.1.5_0: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
ai-an3:2.2.1_0: A astute person is known by three things.
ai-an3:2.2.3_0: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:2.2.4_0: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
ai-an3:2.3.1_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an3:2.3.2_0: ‘We will reject the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’
ai-an3:3.1.1_0: “There are these three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of a fool.
ai-an3:3.1.3_0: A fool thinks poorly, speaks poorly, and acts poorly.
ai-an3:3.1.4_0: If a fool didn’t think poorly, speak poorly, and act poorly, then how would the astute know of them:
ai-an3:3.1.5_0: ‘This fellow is a fool, a bad person’.
ai-an3:3.1.6_0: But since a fool does think poorly, speak poorly, and act poorly, then the astute do know of them:
ai-an3:3.1.7_0: ‘This fellow is a fool, a bad person’.
ai-an3:3.1.8_0: These are the three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of a fool.
ai-an3:3.2.1_0: There are these three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of an astute person.
ai-an3:3.2.3_0: It’s when an astute person does think well, speak well, and act well.
ai-an3:3.2.4_0: If an astute person didn’t think well, speak well, and act well, then how would the astute know of them:
ai-an3:3.2.5_0: ‘This fellow is astute, a good person’.
ai-an3:3.2.6_0: But since an astute person does think well, speak well, and act well, then the astute do know of them,
ai-an3:3.2.7_0: ‘This fellow is astute, a good person’.
ai-an3:3.2.8_0: These are the three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of an astute person.
ai-an3:4.1.1_0: “A fool is known by three things.
ai-an3:4.1.3_0: They don’t recognize when they’ve made a mistake. When they recognize it they deal with it properly. And when someone else confesses a mistake to them, they don’t properly accept it.
ai-an3:4.1.4_0: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
ai-an3:4.2.1_0: A astute person is known by three things.
ai-an3:4.2.3_0: They recognize when they’ve made a mistake. When they recognize it they deal with it properly. And when someone else confesses a mistake to them, they accept it properly.
ai-an3:4.2.4_0: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
ai-an3:5.1.1_0: “A fool is known by three things.
ai-an3:5.1.3_0: They ask a question improperly. They answer a question improperly. And when someone else answers a question properly—with well-rounded, coherent, and relevant words and phrases—they disagree with it.
ai-an3:5.1.4_0: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
ai-an3:5.2.1_0: A astute person is known by three things.
ai-an3:5.2.3_0: They ask a question properly. They answer a question properly. And when someone else answers a question properly—with well-rounded, coherent, and relevant words and phrases—they agree with it.
ai-an3:5.2.4_0: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
ai-an3:6.1.1_0: “A fool is known by three things.
ai-an3:6.1.3_0: Unskillful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:6.1.4_0: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
ai-an3:6.2.1_0: A astute person is known by three things.
ai-an3:6.2.3_0: Skillful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:6.2.4_0: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
ai-an3:6.2.6_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an3:7.1.1_0: “A fool is known by three things.
ai-an3:7.1.3_0: Blameworthy deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. ...
ai-an3:7.1.3_1: Blameless deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. ...”
ai-an3:8.1.1_0: “A fool is known by three things.
ai-an3:8.1.3_0: Hurtful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. ...”
ai-an3:8.1.3_1: Pleasing deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:8.1.4_0: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
ai-an3:8.2.1_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an3:8.2.2_0: ‘We will reject the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’
ai-an3:9.1.1_0: “When a foolish, incompetent, bad person has three qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an3:9.1.3_0: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:9.1.4_0: When a foolish, incompetent bad person has these three qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an3:9.2.1_0: When an astute, competent good person has three qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.
ai-an3:9.2.3_0: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:9.2.4_0: When an astute, competent good person has these three qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.”
ai-an3:10.1.1_0: “Anyone who has three qualities, and has not given up three stains, is cast down to hell.
ai-an3:10.1.3_0: They’re unethical, and haven’t given up the stain of immorality.
ai-an3:10.1.4_0: They’re jealous, and haven’t given up the stain of jealousy.
ai-an3:10.1.5_0: They’re stingy, and haven’t given up the stain of stinginess.
ai-an3:10.1.6_0: Anyone who has these three qualities, and has not given up these three stains, is cast down to hell.
ai-an3:10.2.1_0: Anyone who has three qualities, and has given up three stains, is raised up to heaven.
ai-an3:10.2.3_0: They’re ethical, and have given up the stain of immorality.
ai-an3:10.2.4_0: They’re not jealous, and have given up the stain of jealousy.
ai-an3:10.2.5_0: They’re not stingy, and have given up the stain of stinginess.
ai-an3:10.2.6_0: Anyone who has these three qualities, and has given up these three stains, is raised up to heaven.”
ai-an3:10.2.8_0: The first sub-chapter on nakedness is finished.
ai-an3:10.3.1_0: Regardless, and the marks are impermanent,
ai-an3:11.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a well-known mendicant who has three qualities is acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an3:11.1.3_0: They encourage deeds of body and speech, as well as principles, that don’t reinforce good qualities.
ai-an3:11.1.4_0: A well-known mendicant who has these three qualities is acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an3:11.2.1_0: A well-known mendicant who has three qualities is acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an3:11.2.3_0: They encourage others to do the same.
ai-an3:11.2.4_0: A well-known mendicant who has these three qualities is acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
ai-an3:12.1.1_0: “An anointed aristocratic king should commemorate three places as long as he lives.
ai-an3:12.2.1_0: The place he was anointed as king.
ai-an3:12.3.1_0: The place he was anointed as king.
ai-an3:12.3.3_0: These are the three places an anointed king should commemorate as long as he lives.
ai-an3:12.4.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant should commemorate three places as long as they live.
ai-an3:12.4.3_0: The place where the mendicant shaved off their hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and went forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an3:12.5.1_0: The place where the mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:12.6.1_0: The place where the mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:12.6.3_0: These are the three places a mendicant should commemorate as long as they live.”
ai-an3:13.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:13.1.3_0: The hopeless, the hopeful, and the one who has done away with hope.
ai-an3:13.1.4_0: And what, mendicants, is a hopeless person?
ai-an3:13.1.5_0: It’s when some person is reborn in a low family ...
ai-an3:13.1.6_0: And they’re ugly, unsightly, deformed, chronically ill—one-eyed, crippled, lame, or half-paralyzed. They don’t get to have food, drink, clothes, and vehicles; garlands, fragrances, and makeup; or bed, house, and lighting.
ai-an3:13.1.8_0: ‘They say the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
ai-an3:13.1.10_0: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
ai-an3:13.1.11_0: This is called a hopeless person.
ai-an3:13.2.1_0: And what, mendicants, is a hopeful person?
ai-an3:13.2.2_0: It’s when some person is the eldest son of an anointed aristocratic king. He has not yet been anointed, but is eligible, and has been confirmed in the succession.
ai-an3:13.2.4_0: ‘They say the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
ai-an3:13.2.6_0: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
ai-an3:13.2.7_0: This is called a hopeful person.
ai-an3:13.3.1_0: And what, mendicants, is a person who has done away with hope?
ai-an3:13.3.2_0: It’s when a king has been anointed.
ai-an3:13.3.4_0: ‘They say the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
ai-an3:13.3.6_0: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
ai-an3:13.3.8_0: Because when they haven’t become dissatisfied, with nothing left over,
ai-an3:13.3.9_0: This is called a person who has done away with hope.
ai-an3:13.3.10_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:13.4.1_0: In the same way, these three kinds of people are found among the mendicants.
ai-an3:13.4.3_0: The hopeless, the hopeful, and the one who has done away with hope.
ai-an3:13.4.4_0: And what, mendicants, is a hopeless person?
ai-an3:13.4.5_0: It’s a person who is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.
ai-an3:13.4.7_0: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an3:13.4.9_0: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. ...’
ai-an3:13.4.10_0: This is called a hopeless person.
ai-an3:13.5.1_0: And what, mendicants, is a hopeful person?
ai-an3:13.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, of good character.
ai-an3:13.5.4_0: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an3:13.5.6_0: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. ...’
ai-an3:13.5.7_0: This is called a hopeful person.
ai-an3:13.6.1_0: And what, mendicants, is a person who has done away with hope?
ai-an3:13.6.2_0: It’s a mendicant who is perfected, and has ended defilements.
ai-an3:13.6.4_0: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an3:13.6.6_0: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an3:13.6.9_0: This is called a person who has done away with hope.
ai-an3:13.6.10_0: These are the three people found among the mendicants.”
ai-an3:14.1.1_0: “Mendicants, even a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king, does not wield power without having their own king.”
ai-an3:14.1.2_0: When he said this, one of the mendicants asked the Buddha,
ai-an3:14.1.3_0: “But who is the king of the wheel-turning monarch, the just and principled king?”
ai-an3:14.1.4_0: “It is principle, monk,” said the Buddha.
ai-an3:14.1.5_0: “Monk, a wheel-turning monarch provides just protection and security for his court, relying only on principle—honoring, respecting, and venerating principle, having principle as his flag, banner, and authority.
ai-an3:14.2.1_0: He provides just protection and security for his aristocrats, vassals, troops, brahmins and householders, people of town and country, ascetics and brahmins, beasts and birds.
ai-an3:14.2.2_0: When he has done this, he wields power only in a principled manner.
ai-an3:14.2.2_1: When he has power and brahmins and householders, he wields power, ascetics and brahmins and householders, and ascetics and brahmins.
ai-an3:14.2.3_0: And this power cannot be undermined by any human enemy.
ai-an3:14.3.1_0: In the same way, monk, a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, a just and principled king, provides just protection and security regarding bodily actions, relying only on principle—honoring, respecting, and venerating principle, having principle as his flag, banner, and authority.
ai-an3:14.3.2_0: ‘This kind of bodily action should be cultivated. This kind of bodily action should not be cultivated.’
ai-an3:14.4.1_0: Furthermore, a Realized One ... provides just protection and security regarding verbal actions, saying:
ai-an3:14.4.2_0: ‘This kind of verbal action should be cultivated. This kind of verbal action should not be cultivated.’ ... And regarding mental actions:
ai-an3:14.4.3_0: ‘This kind of mental action should be cultivated. This kind of mental action should not be cultivated.’
ai-an3:14.5.1_0: When a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha has provided just protection and security for his actions, relying only on principle—honoring, respecting, and venerating principle, having principle as his flag, banner, and authority.
ai-an3:14.5.2_0: And that wheel cannot be rolled back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.”
ai-an3:15.1.1_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling near Bārāṇasī in the Deer Park at Isipatana.
ai-an3:15.2.1_0: “Once upon a time there was a king named Pacetana.
ai-an3:15.2.2_0: Then King Pacetana addressed his chariot-maker,
ai-an3:15.2.3_0: ‘In six months’ time, my good chariot-maker, there will be a battle.
ai-an3:15.2.4_0: Are you able to make me a new pair of wheels?’
ai-an3:15.2.5_0: ‘I can, Your Majesty,’ replied the chariot-maker.
ai-an3:15.2.6_0: Then, when it was six days less than six months later, the chariot-maker had finished one wheel.
ai-an3:15.2.7_0: Then King Pacetana addressed his chariot-maker,
ai-an3:15.2.8_0: ‘In six days my good chariot-maker, there will be a ninth day.’
ai-an3:15.2.9_0: ‘Now that it is six days less than six months, Your Majesty, I have finished one wheel.’
ai-an3:15.2.10_0: ‘Are you able to finish the second wheel in these six days?’
ai-an3:15.2.11_0: Saying, ‘I can, Your Majesty,’ the chariot-maker finished the second wheel in six days. Taking the pair of wheels he went up to King Pacetana,
ai-an3:15.2.11_1: and after going, he said this to the King:
ai-an3:15.2.12_0: ‘Sire, the ninth pair of wheels is finished.’
ai-an3:15.2.13_0: ‘But, my good chariot-maker, what is the difference between the wheel that was finished in six days less than six months, and the wheel finished in just six days?
ai-an3:15.2.14_0: Because I can’t see any difference between them.’
ai-an3:15.2.15_0: ‘Sire, there is such a difference between them.
ai-an3:15.3.1_0: Then the chariot-maker rolled forth the wheel that had been finished in six days.
ai-an3:15.3.2_0: It rolled as far as the original impetus took it, then wobbled and fell down.
ai-an3:15.3.3_0: And the permutation series on the ground, adding, “But six months have been finished.”
ai-an3:15.3.4_0: It rolled as far as the original impetus took it, it seems as if grazed.
ai-an3:15.4.1_0: ‘But what is the cause, my good chariot-maker, what is the reason why the wheel that was finished in six days wobbled and fell,
ai-an3:15.4.2_0: while the one that was finished in six days less than six months stood still as if fixed to an axle?’
ai-an3:15.4.3_0: ‘The wheel that was finished in six days, Your Majesty, is crooked, flawed, and defective in rim, spoke, and hub.
ai-an3:15.4.4_0: That’s why it stood still as if fixed to an axle.
ai-an3:15.4.5_0: Whatever he cannot be put out from the wheel that was finished in six months, nor did he say about the animal realm, nor indeed.
ai-an3:15.4.6_0: That’s why it stood still as if fixed to an axle.’
ai-an3:15.5.2_0: ‘Surely that chariot-maker must have been someone else at that time?’
ai-an3:15.5.3_0: But you should not see it like that.
ai-an3:15.5.4_0: I myself was the chariot-maker at that time.
ai-an3:15.5.5_0: Then I was skilled in the crooks, flaws, and defects of wood.
ai-an3:15.5.6_0: Now that I am a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, I am skilled in the crooks, flaws, and defects of actions by body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:15.5.7_0: Whatever monk or nun has not given up the crooks, flaws, and defects of body, speech, and mind has fallen from the teaching and training, just like the wheel that was finished in six days.
ai-an3:15.6.1_0: Whatever monk or nun has given up the crooks, flaws, and defects of body, speech, and mind is established in the teaching and training, just like the wheel that was finished in six days less than six months.
ai-an3:15.7.1_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an3:15.7.2_0: ‘We will give up the crooks, flaws, and defects of body, speech, and mind.’
ai-an3:16.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has three things their practice is guaranteed, and they have laid the groundwork for ending the defilements.
ai-an3:16.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant guards the sense doors, eats in moderation, and is dedicated to wakefulness.
ai-an3:16.2.1_0: And how does a mendicant guard the sense doors?
ai-an3:16.2.2_0: When a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-an3:16.2.3_0: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of sight, and achieving its restraint.
ai-an3:16.2.4_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-an3:16.2.5_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-an3:16.2.6_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-an3:16.2.7_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...
ai-an3:16.2.8_0: Knowing a thought with their mind, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-an3:16.2.9_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of mind, and achieving its restraint.
ai-an3:16.2.10_0: That’s how a mendicant guards the sense doors.
ai-an3:16.3.1_0: And how does a mendicant eat in moderation?
ai-an3:16.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant reflects properly on the food that they eat:
ai-an3:16.3.3_0: ‘Not for fun, indulgence, adornment, or decoration, but only to sustain this body, to avoid harm, and to support spiritual practice. In this way, I shall put an end to old discomfort and not give rise to new discomfort, and I will live blamelessly and at ease.’
ai-an3:16.3.4_0: That’s how a mendicant eats in moderation.
ai-an3:16.4.1_0: And how is a mendicant committed to wakefulness?
ai-an3:16.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant practices walking and sitting meditation by day, purifying their mind from obstacles. In the evening, they continue to practice walking and sitting meditation. In the middle of the night, they lie down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up. In the last part of the night, they get up and continue to practice walking and sitting meditation, purifying their mind from obstacles.
ai-an3:16.4.3_0: This is how a mendicant is dedicated to wakefulness.
ai-an3:16.4.4_0: When a mendicant has these three things their practice is guaranteed, and they have laid the groundwork for ending the defilements.”
ai-an3:16.4.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an3:17.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these three things lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, and hurting both.
ai-an3:17.1.4_0: These are three things that lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, and hurting both.
ai-an3:17.2.1_0: These three things don’t lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, or hurting both.
ai-an3:17.2.3_0: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:17.2.4_0: These are three things that don’t lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, or hurting both.”
ai-an3:18.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow another path were to ask you:
ai-an3:18.1.2_0: ‘Reverend, do you lead the spiritual life with the ascetic Gotama so that you can be reborn in the realm of the gods?’
ai-an3:18.1.3_0: When you’re asked this, would you be horrified, repelled, and disgusted with?”
ai-an3:18.1.5_0: “So it seems that you are horrified, repelled, and disgusted by divine lifespan, beauty, happiness, fame, and sovereignty.
ai-an3:18.1.6_0: How much more then should you be horrified, embarrassed, and disgusted by bad conduct.
ai-an3:18.1.6_1: corruption, embarrassed, and disgusted by bad mental conduct.”
ai-an3:19.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a shopkeeper who has three factors is unable to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.1.3_0: It’s when a shopkeeper doesn’t carefully apply themselves to their work in the morning, at midday, and in the afternoon.
ai-an3:19.1.4_0: A shopkeeper who has these three factors is unable to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.2.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant who has three factors is unable to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t carefully apply themselves to a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion in the morning, at midday, and in the afternoon.
ai-an3:19.2.4_0: A mendicant who has these three factors is unable to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.3.1_0: A shopkeeper who has three factors is able to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.3.3_0: It’s when a shopkeeper carefully applies themselves to their work in the morning ...
ai-an3:19.3.3_1: In the evening time, at the time they carefully apply themselves to their work.
ai-an3:19.3.4_0: A shopkeeper who has these three factors is able to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.4.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant who has three factors is able to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:19.4.3_0: It’s when a mendicant carefully applies themselves to a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion in the morning, at midday, and in the morning.
ai-an3:19.4.3_1: and in the evening time, he settles on the signless immersion.
ai-an3:19.4.4_0: A mendicant who has these three factors is able to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.”
ai-an3:20.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a shopkeeper who has three factors soon acquires great and abundant wealth.
ai-an3:20.1.3_0: It’s when a shopkeeper sees clearly, is responsible, and has supporters.
ai-an3:20.1.4_0: And how does a shopkeeper see clearly?
ai-an3:20.1.5_0: It’s when a shopkeeper knows what is a shopkeeper.
ai-an3:20.1.6_0: ‘This product is bought at this price and is selling at this price. With this much investment, it’ll bring this much profit.’
ai-an3:20.1.7_0: That’s how a shopkeeper sees clearly.
ai-an3:20.2.1_0: And how does a shopkeeper responsible?
ai-an3:20.2.2_0: It’s when a shopkeeper is skilled in palace and embracing.
ai-an3:20.2.3_0: That’s how a shopkeeper is responsible.
ai-an3:20.3.1_0: And how does a shopkeeper have supporters?
ai-an3:20.3.2_0: It’s when rich, affluent, and wealthy householders or householders’ children know of him:
ai-an3:20.3.3_0: ‘This good shopkeeper keeps an eye out and is responsible. They are capable of providing for their wives and children, and paying us back from time to time.’
ai-an3:20.3.4_0: They deposit money with the shopkeeper, saying:
ai-an3:20.3.5_0: ‘Mister, please set out for my home to provide for your children and partners.’
ai-an3:20.3.6_0: That’s how a shopkeeper has supporters.
ai-an3:20.3.7_0: A shopkeeper who has these three factors soon acquires great and abundant wealth.
ai-an3:20.4.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant who has three factors soon acquires great and abundant skillful qualities.
ai-an3:20.4.3_0: It’s when a mendicant sees clearly, is responsible, and has supporters.
ai-an3:20.4.4_0: And how does a mendicant see clearly?
ai-an3:20.4.5_0: They truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:20.4.6_0: That’s how a mendicant sees clearly.
ai-an3:20.5.1_0: And how is a mendicant responsible?
ai-an3:20.5.2_0: It’s for a mendicant who lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-an3:20.5.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is responsible.
ai-an3:20.6.1_0: And how does a mendicant have supporters?
ai-an3:20.6.2_0: It’s when from time to time a mendicant goes up to those mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—and asks them questions:
ai-an3:20.6.3_0: ‘Why, sir, does it say this? What does that mean?’
ai-an3:20.6.4_0: Those venerables clarify what is unclear, reveal what is obscure, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.
ai-an3:20.6.5_0: That’s how a mendicant has supporters.
ai-an3:20.6.6_0: A mendicant who has these three factors soon acquires great and abundant skillful qualities.”
ai-an3:20.6.8_0: The first recitation section is finished.
ai-an3:20.6.9_0: The first recitation section is finished.
ai-an3:21.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an3:21.1.3_0: Then Venerable Saviṭṭha and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita went up to Venerable Sāriputta.
ai-an3:21.1.3_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an3:21.1.4_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
ai-an3:21.2.1_0: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, these three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:21.2.3_0: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
ai-an3:21.2.4_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:21.2.5_0: Of these three people, who do you believe to be the finest?”
ai-an3:21.3.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:21.3.3_0: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
ai-an3:21.3.4_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:21.3.5_0: Of these three people, I believe the person freed by faith to be finest.
ai-an3:21.3.7_0: Because this person’s faculty of faith is outstanding.”
ai-an3:21.4.2_0: “Reverend Koṭṭhika, these three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:21.4.4_0: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
ai-an3:21.4.5_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:21.4.6_0: Of these three people, who do you believe to be the finest?”
ai-an3:21.5.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:21.5.3_0: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
ai-an3:21.5.4_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:21.5.5_0: Of these three people, I believe the person to be the finest.
ai-an3:21.5.7_0: Because this person’s faculty of immersion is outstanding.”
ai-an3:21.6.2_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:21.6.4_0: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
ai-an3:21.6.5_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:21.6.6_0: Of these three people, who do you believe to be the finest?”
ai-an3:21.7.1_0: “Reverend Koṭṭhika, these three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:21.7.3_0: The personal witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.
ai-an3:21.7.4_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:21.7.5_0: Of these three people, I believe the person attained to view to be finest.
ai-an3:21.7.7_0: Because this person’s faculty of wisdom is outstanding.”
ai-an3:21.8.1_0: Then Sāriputta said to Saviṭṭha and Mahākoṭṭhita,
ai-an3:21.8.2_0: “Each of us has spoken from the heart.
ai-an3:21.8.3_0: Come, reverends, let’s go to the Buddha, and tell him about this.
ai-an3:21.8.4_0: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
ai-an3:21.8.6_0: Then Sāriputta, Saviṭṭha, and Mahākoṭṭhita went up to the Buddha.
ai-an3:21.8.6_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-an3:21.8.7_0: Then Sāriputta told the Buddha of all they had discussed.
ai-an3:21.9.1_0: “In this matter, Sāriputta, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
ai-an3:21.9.2_0: one of these three people is finest.
ai-an3:21.9.3_0: In some cases, a personal witness is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.
ai-an3:21.10.1_0: In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
ai-an3:21.10.2_0: one of these three people is finest.
ai-an3:21.10.3_0: In some cases, a personal witness is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.
ai-an3:21.11.1_0: In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
ai-an3:21.11.2_0: one of these three people is finest.
ai-an3:21.11.3_0: In some cases, one attained to view is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the personal witness are once-returners or non-returners.
ai-an3:21.12.1_0: In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that
ai-an3:21.12.2_0: one of these three people is finest.”
ai-an3:22.1.1_0: “These three patients are found in the world.
ai-an3:22.1.3_0: In some cases a patient won’t recover from an illness, regardless of whether or not they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer.
ai-an3:22.2.1_0: In some cases a patient will recover from an illness, regardless of whether or not they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer.
ai-an3:22.3.1_0: In some cases a patient can recover from an illness, but only if they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer, and not if they don’t get these things.
ai-an3:22.4.1_0: Now, it’s for the sake of the last patient—who will recover only if they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer—that food, medicines, and a carer are prescribed.
ai-an3:22.4.2_0: But also, for the sake of this patient, the other patients should be looked after.
ai-an3:22.4.3_0: These are the three kinds of patients found in the world.
ai-an3:22.5.1_0: In the same way, these three people similar to patients are found in the world.
ai-an3:22.5.3_0: Some people do not enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, regardless of whether or not they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims.
ai-an3:22.6.1_0: Some people do enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, regardless of whether or not they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims.
ai-an3:22.7.1_0: Some people can enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, but only if they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims, and not when they don’t get those things.
ai-an3:22.8.1_0: Now, it’s for the sake of this last person that teaching the Dhamma is prescribed, that is, the one who can enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, but only if they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims.
ai-an3:22.8.2_0: But also, for the sake of this person, the other people should be taught Dhamma.
ai-an3:22.8.3_0: These are the three people similar to patients found in the world.”
ai-an3:23.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:23.1.3_0: It’s when a person makes hurtful choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:23.1.4_0: Having made these choices, they’re reborn in a hurtful world,
ai-an3:23.1.6_0: Touched by hurtful contacts, they experience hurtful feelings that are exclusively painful—like the beings in hell.
ai-an3:23.2.1_0: Furthermore, another person makes pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:23.2.2_0: Having made these choices, they are reborn in a pleasing world,
ai-an3:23.2.3_0: There they experience pleasing contacts that are free of affliction,
ai-an3:23.2.4_0: Touched by pleasing contacts, they experience pleasing feelings that are exclusively happy—like the gods replete with glory.
ai-an3:23.3.1_0: Furthermore, another person makes both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:23.3.2_0: Having made these choices, they’re reborn in a hurtful world,
ai-an3:23.3.4_0: Touched by both hurtful and pleasing contacts, they experience both hurtful and pleasing feelings that are a mixture of pleasure and pain—like humans, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.
ai-an3:23.3.5_0: These are the three people found in the world.”
ai-an3:24.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these three people are very helpful to an individual.
ai-an3:24.1.3_0: The person who has enabled you to go for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-an3:24.1.4_0: This person is very helpful to another.
ai-an3:24.2.1_0: Furthermore, the person who has enabled you to truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:24.2.2_0: This person is very helpful to another.
ai-an3:24.3.1_0: Furthermore, the person who has enabled you to realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with your own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:24.3.2_0: This person is very helpful to another.
ai-an3:24.3.3_0: These are the three people very helpful to an individual.
ai-an3:24.4.1_0: And of these three people, I say that person is not very helpful, but because it’s helpful, I say.
ai-an3:24.4.2_0: And I also say that it’s not easy to repay these three people by bowing down to them, rising up for them, greeting them with joined palms, and observing proper etiquette for them; or by providing them with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.”
ai-an3:25.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:25.1.3_0: A person with a mind like an open sore, a person with a mind like lightning, and a person with a mind like diamond.
ai-an3:25.1.4_0: And who is the person with a mind like an open sore?
ai-an3:25.1.5_0: It’s someone who is irritable and bad-tempered.
ai-an3:25.1.6_0: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an3:25.1.7_0: They’re like a festering sore, which, when you hit it with a stick or a stone, discharges even more.
ai-an3:25.1.8_0: In the same way, someone is irritable and bad-tempered.
ai-an3:25.1.9_0: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an3:25.1.10_0: This is called a person with a mind like an open sore.
ai-an3:25.2.1_0: And who has a mind like lightning?
ai-an3:25.2.2_0: It’s someone who truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:25.2.3_0: They’re like a person with keen eyes in the dark of the night, who sees by a flash of lightning.
ai-an3:25.2.4_0: In the same way, someone truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:25.2.4_1: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:25.2.5_0: This is called a person with a mind like lightning.
ai-an3:25.3.1_0: And who is the person with a mind like diamond?
ai-an3:25.3.2_0: It’s someone who realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:25.3.3_0: It’s like a diamond, which can’t be cut by anything at all, not even a gem or a stone.
ai-an3:25.3.4_0: In the same way, someone realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. ...
ai-an3:25.3.5_0: This is called a person with a mind like diamond.
ai-an3:25.3.6_0: These are the three people found in the world.”
ai-an3:26.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:26.1.3_0: There is a person you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:26.1.4_0: There is a person you should associate with, accompany, and attend.
ai-an3:26.1.5_0: There is a person you should associate with, accompany, and attend with honor and respect.
ai-an3:26.1.6_0: Who is the person you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend?
ai-an3:26.1.7_0: It’s someone who is inferior in terms of ethics, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-an3:26.1.8_0: You shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend such a person, apart from compassion.
ai-an3:26.2.1_0: Who is the person you should associate with, accompany, and attend?
ai-an3:26.2.2_0: It’s someone who is similar in terms of ethics, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-an3:26.2.3_0: You should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person.
ai-an3:26.2.5_0: Since our ethical conduct is similar, we can discuss ethical, the conversation will flow, and we’ll both be at ease.
ai-an3:26.2.6_0: Since our immersion is similar, we can discuss immersion, the conversation will flow, and we’ll both be at ease.
ai-an3:26.2.7_0: Since our wisdom is similar, we can discuss wisdom, the conversation will flow, and we’ll both be at ease.’
ai-an3:26.2.8_0: That’s why you should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person.
ai-an3:26.3.1_0: Who is the person you should associate with, accompany, and attend with honor and respect?
ai-an3:26.3.2_0: It’s someone who is superior in terms of ethics, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-an3:26.3.3_0: You should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person with honor and respect.
ai-an3:26.3.5_0: Thinking, ‘I’ll fulfill the entire spectrum of ethical conduct I haven’t yet fulfilled, or support with wisdom in every situation the ethical conduct I’ve already fulfilled.
ai-an3:26.3.6_0: I’ll fulfill the entire spectrum of immersion, or support with wisdom in every situation the wisdom I’ve already fulfilled.’
ai-an3:26.3.7_0: I’ll fulfill the entire spectrum of wisdom I haven’t yet fulfilled, or support with wisdom in every situation the wisdom I’ve already fulfilled.’
ai-an3:26.3.8_0: That’s why you should associate with, accompany, and attend this person with honor and respect.
ai-an3:26.3.9_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:26.4.1_0: A person is low by mixing with the lowly,
ai-an3:26.4.2_0: He should not be destroyers, goodness with (right) goodness,
ai-an3:26.4.3_0: By inclining to the best he quickly rises up,
ai-an3:26.4.4_0: so you should keep company with people better than you.”
ai-an3:26.4.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an3:27.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:27.1.3_0: There is a person who you should be disgusted by, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:27.1.4_0: There is a person you should regard with equanimity, and not associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:27.1.5_0: There is a person you should associate with, accompany, and attend.
ai-an3:27.1.6_0: Who is the person you should be disgusted by, and not associate with, accompany, or attend?
ai-an3:27.1.7_0: It’s a person who is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.
ai-an3:27.1.8_0: You should be disgusted by such a person, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:27.1.10_0: Even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a bad reputation:
ai-an3:27.1.11_0: ‘That individual has bad friends, companions, and associates.’
ai-an3:27.1.12_0: They’re like a snake that’s been living in a pile of dung. Even if it doesn’t bite, it’ll still rub off on you.
ai-an3:27.1.13_0: In the same way, even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a bad reputation:
ai-an3:27.1.14_0: ‘That individual has bad friends, companions, and associates.’
ai-an3:27.1.15_0: That’s why you should be disgusted by such a person, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:27.2.1_0: Who is the person you should regard with equanimity, and not associate with, accompany, or attend?
ai-an3:27.2.2_0: It’s someone who is irritable and bad-tempered.
ai-an3:27.2.3_0: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an3:27.2.4_0: They’re like a festering sore, which, when you hit it with a stick or a stone, discharges even more.
ai-an3:27.2.6_0: They’re like a firebrand of pale-moon ebony, which, when you hit it with a stick or a stone, sizzles and crackles even more.
ai-an3:27.2.8_0: They’re like a sewer, which, when you stir it with a stick or a stone, stinks even more.
ai-an3:27.2.9_0: In the same way, someone is irritable and bad-tempered.
ai-an3:27.2.10_0: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an3:27.2.11_0: You should regard such a person with equanimity, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:27.2.13_0: Thinking, ‘They might abuse or insult me, or do me harm.’
ai-an3:27.2.14_0: That’s why you should regard such a person with equanimity, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.
ai-an3:27.3.1_0: Who is the person you should associate with, accompany, and attend?
ai-an3:27.3.2_0: It’s someone who is ethical, of good character.
ai-an3:27.3.3_0: You should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person.
ai-an3:27.3.5_0: Even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a good reputation:
ai-an3:27.3.6_0: ‘That individual has good friends, companions, and associates.’
ai-an3:27.3.7_0: That’s why you should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person.
ai-an3:27.3.8_0: These are the three people found in the world.
ai-an3:27.4.1_0: A person is low by mixing with the lowly,
ai-an3:27.4.2_0: He should not be destroyers, goodness with (right) goodness,
ai-an3:27.4.3_0: By inclining to the best he quickly rises up,
ai-an3:27.4.4_0: so you should keep company with people better than you.”
ai-an3:28.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:28.1.3_0: One with speech like dung, one with speech like flowers, and one with speech like honey.
ai-an3:28.1.4_0: And who has speech like dung?
ai-an3:28.1.5_0: It’s someone who is summoned to a council, an assembly, a family meeting, a guild, or to the royal court, and asked to bear witness:
ai-an3:28.1.5_7: Not for the sake of his self, or for the sake of another or for the sake of a trifling material gain,
ai-an3:28.1.6_0: This is called a person with speech like dung.
ai-an3:28.2.1_0: And who has speech like flowers?
ai-an3:28.2.2_0: It’s someone who is summoned to a council, an assembly, a family meeting, a guild, or to the royal court, and asked to bear witness:
ai-an3:28.2.2_1: ‘Please, mister, say what you know.’ Not being able to speak.
ai-an3:28.2.2_6: Not for the sake of his self, or for the sake of another or for the sake of a trifling material gain,
ai-an3:28.2.3_0: This is called a person with speech like flowers.
ai-an3:28.3.1_0: And who has speech like honey?
ai-an3:28.3.2_0: It’s when a person gives up harsh speech.
ai-an3:28.3.3_0: They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.
ai-an3:28.3.4_0: This is called a person with speech like honey.
ai-an3:28.3.5_0: These are the three people found in the world.”
ai-an3:29.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:29.1.3_0: The blind, the one-eyed, and the two-eyed.
ai-an3:29.1.4_0: And who is the person blind and blind?
ai-an3:29.1.5_0: It’s someone who doesn’t have the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
ai-an3:29.1.6_0: And they don’t have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.
ai-an3:29.1.7_0: This person is called blind and blind.

ai-an3:36.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these three messengers of the gods.
ai-an3:36.1.3_0: Firstly, someone does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:36.1.4_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an3:36.1.5_0: Then the wardens of hell take them by the arms and present them to King Yama, saying:
ai-an3:36.1.6_0: ‘Your Majesty, this person did not pay due respect to their mother and father, ascetics and brahmins, or honor the elders in the family.
ai-an3:36.2.1_0: Then King Yama pursues, presses, and grills them about the first messenger of the gods.
ai-an3:36.2.2_0: ‘Mister, did you not see the first messenger of the gods that appeared among human beings?’
ai-an3:36.3.2_0: ‘Mister, did you not see among human beings an elderly woman or a man—eighty, ninety, or a hundred years old—bent double, crooked, leaning on a staff, trembling as they walk, ailing, past their prime, with teeth broken, hair grey and scanty or bald, skin wrinkled, and limbs blotchy?’
ai-an3:36.4.2_0: ‘Mister, did it not occur to you—being sensible and mature—
ai-an3:36.4.3_0: “I, too, am liable to grow old. I’m not exempt from old age. I’d better do good by way of body, speech, and mind”?’
ai-an3:36.5.2_0: ‘Mister, did you not do good things by way of body, speech, and mind?
ai-an3:36.5.3_0: Indeed, they’ll definitely punish you to fit your negligence.
ai-an3:36.5.4_0: That bad deed wasn’t done by your mother, father, brother, or sister. It wasn’t done by friends and colleagues, by relatives and kin, by the deities, or by ascetics and brahmins.
ai-an3:36.5.5_0: That bad deed was done by you alone, and you alone will experience the result.’
ai-an3:36.6.1_0: Then King Yama grills them about the second messenger of the gods:
ai-an3:36.6.2_0: ‘Mister, did you not see the second messenger of the gods that appeared among human beings?’

ai-an3:50.1.3_0: A master thief relies on uneven ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals.

ai-an3:50.2.1_0: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?
ai-an3:50.2.2_0: It’s when a master thief relies on grass or trees. And it’s robbed or a big tree, or a large forest grove.
ai-an3:50.2.3_0: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.
ai-an3:50.3.1_0: And how does a master thief rely on powerful individuals?
ai-an3:50.3.2_0: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their ministers.

ai-an3:51.1.1_0: Then two old brahmins—elderly and senior, who were advanced in years and had reached the final stage of life—they went up to the Buddha.

ai-an3:51.1.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.

ai-an3:51.1.3_0: “We brahmins, Master Gotama, are old, elderly and senior, we’re advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; we’re a hundred and twenty years old.
ai-an3:51.1.4_0: And we haven’t done what is good and skillful, nor have we made a shelter from fear.
ai-an3:51.1.5_0: Advise us, Master Gotama, instruct us! It will be for our lasting welfare and happiness.”

ai-an3:51.2.3_0: This world is led on by old age, sickness, and death.

ai-an3:51.4.4_0: as the good deeds done while living.”

ai-an3:52.1.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-an3:52.1.1_2: While sitting on one side those brahmins said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an3:52.1.2_0: “We brahmins, Master Gotama, are old, elderly and senior, we’re advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; we’re a hundred and twenty years old.
ai-an3:52.1.3_0: And we haven’t done what is good and skillful, nor have we made a shelter from fear.
ai-an3:52.1.4_0: Advise us, Master Gotama, instruct us! It will be for our lasting welfare and happiness.”
ai-an3:52.2.1_0: “Indeed, brahmins, elderly and senior, were advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; we’re a hundred and twenty years old.
ai-an3:52.2.2_0: And you haven’t done what is good and skillful, nor have you made a shelter from fear.
ai-an3:52.2.3_0: This world is burning with old age, sickness, and death.
ai-an3:52.2.4_0: But restraint here by way of body, speech, and mind is the shelter, protection, island, refuge, and haven for the departed.
ai-an3:52.3.1_0: When your house is on fire,
ai-an3:52.4.1_0: And as the world is on fire
ai-an3:52.5.4_0: as the good deeds done while living.”
ai-an3:53.1.1_0: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha.
ai-an3:53.1.1_2: While sat on one side that brahmin said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an3:53.1.2_0: “Master Gotama, they speak of ‘a teaching visible in this very life’.
ai-an3:53.1.3_0: In what way is the teaching visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”
ai-an3:53.2.1_0: “A greedy person, overcome and overwhelmed by greed, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an3:53.2.2_0: When greed has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an3:53.2.3_0: A night in body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:53.2.4_0: When they’ve given up greed, they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:53.2.5_1: They don’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
ai-an3:53.2.6_0: When greed has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.

ai-an3:53.4.3_0: This, too, is how the teaching is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”
ai-an3:53.5.2_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-an3:53.5.2_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-an3:53.5.2_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-an3:53.5.3_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-an3:53.5.4_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

ai-an3:55.1.2_0: “Master Gotama, they say that ‘extinguishment is visible in this very life’.

ai-an3:55.4.2_0: that’s how extinguishment is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”
ai-an3:55.5.2_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an3:56.1.1_0: Then a well-to-do Brahmin went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.
ai-an3:56.1.1_1: Seated to one side, the well-to-do Brahmin said to the Buddha:
ai-an3:56.1.2_0: “Master Gotama, I have heard that brahmins of the past who were elderly and senior, the teachers of teachers, said:
ai-an3:56.1.3_0: ‘In the old days this world was as crowded as hell, just full of people. The villages, towns and capital cities were no more than a chicken’s flight apart.’
ai-an3:56.1.4_0: What is the cause, what is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled?”
ai-an3:56.2.1_0: “These days, brahmin, humans just love illicit desire. They’re overcome by immoral greed, and mired in wrong thoughts.
ai-an3:56.2.2_0: Taking up sharp knives, they murder each other. And so many people perish.
ai-an3:56.2.3_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.
ai-an3:56.3.1_0: Furthermore, because these days humans just love illicit desire ...
ai-an3:56.3.2_0: Sometimes they’re overcome by lust, undisturbed, and wrongly don’t provide enough rain.
ai-an3:56.3.3_0: so there’s famine, a bad harvest, with blighted crops that turn to straw.
ai-an3:56.3.5_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.
ai-an3:56.4.1_0: Furthermore, because these days humans just love illicit desire ...
ai-an3:56.4.2_0: native spirits let vicious monsters loose. And so many people perish.
ai-an3:56.4.3_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.”
ai-an3:56.5.2_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an3:56.5.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an3:57.1.1_0: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha.
ai-an3:57.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an3:57.1.2_1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:
ai-an3:57.1.3_0: “I have heard, Master Gotama, that the ascetic Gotama says this:
ai-an3:57.1.4_0: ‘Gifts should only be given to me, not to others.
ai-an3:57.1.5_0: Gifts should only be given to my disciples, not to the disciples of others.
ai-an3:57.1.6_0: Only what is given to me is very fruitful, not what is given to others.
ai-an3:57.1.7_0: Only what is given to my disciples is very fruitful, not what is given to the disciples of others.’
ai-an3:57.1.9_0: “Gifts should only be given to me, not to others.
ai-an3:57.1.10_0: Gifts should only be given to my disciples, not to the disciples of others.
ai-an3:57.1.11_0: Only what is given to me is very fruitful, not what is given to others.
ai-an3:57.1.12_0: Only what is given to my disciples is very fruitful, not what is given to the disciples of others.”’
ai-an3:57.1.13_0: I trust that those who say this repeat what the Buddha has said, and do not misrepresent him with an untruth? Is their explanation in line with the teaching? Are there any legitimate grounds for rebuke and criticism?
ai-an3:57.1.14_0: For we don’t want to misrepresent Master Gotama.”
ai-an3:57.2.3_0: “Gifts should only be given to me,
ai-an3:57.2.4_0: what is given to their disciples is very fruitful.’
ai-an3:57.2.5_0: I don’t repeat what I have said. And what I have said was untrue.
ai-an3:57.2.6_0: Anyone who prevents another from giving makes an obstacle and a barrier for three people.
ai-an3:57.2.8_0: The giver is obstructed from making merit. The receiver is obstructed from getting what is offered. And they’ve already broken and damaged themselves.
ai-an3:57.2.9_0: Anyone who prevents another from giving makes an obstacle and a barrier for three people.
ai-an3:57.3.1_0: Vaccha, this is what I say:
ai-an3:57.3.2_0: ‘You even make merit by tipping out dish-washing water in a cesspool or a sump with living creatures in it, thinking,
ai-an3:57.3.4_0: How much more then for human beings!
ai-an3:57.3.5_0: However, I also say that a gift to an ethical person is more fruitful than one to an unethical person. They’ve given up five factors, and possess five factors.
ai-an3:57.4.1_0: What are the five factors they’ve given up?
ai-an3:57.4.2_0: Sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-an3:57.4.3_0: These are the five factors they’ve given up.
ai-an3:57.5.1_0: What are the five factors they possess?
ai-an3:57.5.2_0: He has the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom of one fully trained.
ai-an3:57.5.3_0: These are the five factors they possess.
ai-an3:57.5.4_0: Since they have given up these five factors and possesses these five factors, I say.
ai-an3:57.6.1_0: Cows may be black or white,
ai-an3:57.7.1_0: but when one is born among them,
ai-an3:57.7.5_0: they yoke the load just to him,
ai-an3:57.9.1_0: but when one is born among them,
ai-an3:57.9.3_0: Firm in principle, accomplished in ethical conduct,
ai-an3:57.10.1_0: they’ve given up birth and death.
ai-an3:57.10.4_0: they’ve completed the task and are free of defilements.
ai-an3:57.12.3_0: give their gifts to those outside,
ai-an3:57.12.4_0: and don’t attend the peaceful ones.
ai-an3:57.13.3_0: and whose faith in the Holy One
ai-an3:57.14.1_0: they go to the realm of the gods,
ai-an3:57.14.2_0: or family in this very life—
ai-an3:58.1.1_0: Then Tikaṇṇa the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an3:58.1.2_0: Seated to one side, in front of the Buddha, Tikaṇṇa praised the brahmins who were proficient in the three Vedas,
ai-an3:58.1.3_0: “Such are the brahmins, masters of the three Vedic knowledges! Thus are the brahmins, masters of the three Vedic knowledges!”
ai-an3:58.2.1_0: “But brahmin, how do the brahmins describe a brahmin who is master of the three Vedic knowledges?”
ai-an3:58.2.2_0: “Master Gotama, it’s when a brahmin is well born on both his mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation. He recites and remembers the hymns, and has mastered the three Vedas, together with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology and etymology, and the testament as fifth. He knows philology and grammar, and is well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man.
ai-an3:58.2.3_0: That’s how the brahmins describe a brahmin who is master of the three Vedic knowledges.”
ai-an3:58.3.1_0: “Brahmin, a master of three knowledges according to the brahmins is quite different from a master of the three knowledges in the training of the Noble One.”
ai-an3:58.3.2_0: “But Master Gotama, how is one a master of the three knowledges in the training of the Noble One?
ai-an3:58.3.3_0: Master Gotama, please teach me this.”
ai-an3:58.3.4_0: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an3:58.4.1_0: “Brahmin, it’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-an3:58.4.2_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-an3:58.4.3_0: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-an3:58.4.3_1: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-an3:58.4.4_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-an3:58.5.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward recollection of past lives. ...
ai-an3:58.5.2_0: They recollect many kinds of past lives. That is:
ai-an3:58.5.2_1: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths.
ai-an3:58.5.2_2: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-an3:58.5.2_3: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an3:58.5.3_0: This is the first knowledge that they attain.
ai-an3:58.5.4_0: Ignorance was dispelled and knowledge arose.
ai-an3:58.5.4_1: darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-an3:58.6.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings.
ai-an3:58.6.2_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds:
ai-an3:58.6.2_1: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind. ...
ai-an3:58.6.2_2: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an3:58.6.2_3: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an3:58.6.2_4: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an3:58.6.3_0: This is the second knowledge that they attain.
ai-an3:58.6.4_0: Ignorance was dispelled and knowledge arose.
ai-an3:58.6.4_1: darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-an3:58.7.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:58.7.2_0: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ...
ai-an3:58.7.3_0: He truly understands: ‘These are defilements’ ... ‘This is the origin of defilements’ ... ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements’.
ai-an3:58.7.4_0: Knowing and seeing like this, their mind is freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-an3:58.7.5_0: When it is freed, he knows it is freed.
ai-an3:58.7.6_0: He understands: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-an3:58.7.7_0: This is the third knowledge that they attain.
ai-an3:58.7.8_0: Ignorance was dispelled and knowledge arose.
ai-an3:58.7.8_1: darkness is destroyed and light has arisen, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-an3:58.8.1_0: For someone whose ethical conduct doesn’t waver,
ai-an3:58.8.3_0: whose mind is immersed in samādhi,
ai-an3:58.9.1_0: That wise one dispels the darkness,
ai-an3:58.9.2_0: master of the three knowledges, destroyer of death;
ai-an3:58.9.3_0: and explained the method of the teaching
ai-an3:58.9.4_0: he has given up everything, they say.
ai-an3:58.11.2_0: seeing heaven and places of loss,
ai-an3:58.11.3_0: and have attained the end of rebirth;
ai-an3:58.12.2_0: that the brahmin is a master of the three knowledges.
ai-an3:58.12.3_0: I call a master of the three knowledges.
ai-an3:58.13.1_0: This, brahmin, is a master of the three knowledges in the training of the Noble One.”
ai-an3:58.13.2_0: “Master Gotama, the master of three knowledges according to the brahmins is quite different from a master of the three knowledges in the training of the Noble One.
ai-an3:58.13.3_0: And, Master Gotama, a master of three knowledges according to the brahmins is not worth a sixteenth part of a master of the three knowledges in the training of the Noble One.
ai-an3:58.14.2_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
