ai-an3:71.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an3:71.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Channa went up to Venerable Ānanda
ai-an3:71.1.2_1: and after approaching he exchanged greetings with venerable Ānanda,
ai-an3:71.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an3:71.1.3_1: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Ānanda:
ai-an3:71.1.4_0: “Reverend Ānanda, you describe the difference between greed, hate, and delusion.”
ai-an3:71.1.5_0: “Reverends, we describe the giving up of greed, hate, and delusion.”
ai-an3:71.2.1_0: “But what drawbacks have you seen, Reverend Ānanda, that you advocate giving up greed, hate, and delusion?”
ai-an3:71.3.1_0: “A greedy person, overcome and overwhelmed by greed, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an3:71.3.2_0: When greed has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an3:71.3.3_0: A greedy person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:71.3.4_0: When they’ve given up greed, they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:71.3.5_0: A greedy person doesn’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
ai-an3:71.3.6_0: When greed has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
ai-an3:71.3.7_0: Greed is a destroyer of sight, vision, and knowledge; it blocks wisdom, it’s on the side of anguish, and it doesn’t lead to extinguishment.
ai-an3:71.4.1_0: A hateful person, overcome by hate, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. ...
ai-an3:71.4.2_0: A deluded person, overcome by delusion, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an3:71.4.3_0: When delusion has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an3:71.4.4_0: A deluded person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:71.4.5_0: When they’ve given up delusion they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:71.4.6_0: A deluded person doesn’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
ai-an3:71.4.7_0: When delusion has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
ai-an3:71.4.8_0: Delusion is a destroyer of sight, vision, and knowledge; it blocks wisdom, it’s on the side of anguish, and it doesn’t lead to extinguishment.
ai-an3:71.4.9_0: This is the drawback we’ve seen in greed, hate, and delusion, and this is why we advocate giving them up.”
ai-an3:71.4.10_0: This is the drawback of hate, and wisdom.
ai-an3:71.4.11_0: This is the drawback of delusion, giving them up.”
ai-an3:71.5.1_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion?”
ai-an3:71.5.2_0: “There is, reverend, a path and a practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.”
ai-an3:71.5.4_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-an3:71.5.6_0: This is the path, this is the practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.”
ai-an3:71.5.7_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an3:71.5.8_0: But since there’s no need to be diligent.”
ai-an3:72.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-an3:72.1.2_0: Then a certain householder who was a disciple of the Ājīvaka ascetics went to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-an3:72.1.2_1: and after approaching and worshipping venerable Ānanda, he sat down on one side.
ai-an3:72.1.2_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Ānanda:
ai-an3:72.2.2_0: Who in the world are practicing well?
ai-an3:72.2.3_0: Who in the world has done well?”
ai-an3:72.2.4_0: “Well then, householder, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
ai-an3:72.2.6_0: Is the teaching of those who teach for giving up greed, hate, and delusion well explained or not?
ai-an3:72.2.7_0: Or how do you see this?”
ai-an3:72.2.8_0: “The teaching of those who teach for giving up greed, hate, and delusion is well explained.
ai-an3:72.3.2_0: Are those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion practicing well or not?
ai-an3:72.3.3_0: Or how do you see this?”
ai-an3:72.3.4_0: “Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well.
ai-an3:72.4.2_0: Have those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future—done well in the world, or not?
ai-an3:72.4.3_0: Or how do you see this?”
ai-an3:72.4.4_0: “Those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion have done well in the future.
ai-an3:72.4.4_1: Have those who’ve given up delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future—are Holy Ones in the world.
ai-an3:72.5.2_0: ‘The teaching of those who teach for giving up greed, hate, and delusion is well explained.’
ai-an3:72.5.4_0: ‘Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well.’
ai-an3:72.5.6_0: ‘Those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion have done well in the future.’
ai-an3:72.5.6_1: Those who have given up delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the world.’”
ai-an3:72.6.2_0: There’s no acclaiming your own teaching or disrespecting someone else’s,
ai-an3:72.6.3_0: just teaching what’s relevant in that context. The goal is spoken of, but the self is not involved.
ai-an3:72.6.4_0: You, sir, teach Dhamma for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an3:72.6.6_0: You, sir, practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an3:72.6.7_0: You in the world are practicing well.
ai-an3:72.6.8_0: You’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an3:72.6.9_0: You in the world have done well.
ai-an3:72.7.1_0: Excellent, reverend Sir! Excellent, reverend Sir!
ai-an3:72.7.2_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what was hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-an3:72.7.2_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-an3:72.7.2_2: even so has the Dhamma been explained by Ānanda in many ways.
ai-an3:72.7.3_0: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-an3:72.7.4_0: From this day forth, may Venerable Ānanda remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an3:73.1.2_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling amongst the Sakyas, near to Kapilavatthu, in Nigrodha’s Monastery.
ai-an3:73.1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha had recently recovered from an illness.
ai-an3:73.1.4_0: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:73.1.5_0: “For a long time, sir, I have understood your teaching like this:
ai-an3:73.1.6_0: ‘Knowledge is for those with immersion, not those without immersion.’
ai-an3:73.1.7_0: But, sir, does immersion come first, then knowledge?
ai-an3:73.1.8_0: Or does knowledge come first, then immersion?”
ai-an3:73.1.10_0: “The Buddha has recently recovered from an illness,
ai-an3:73.1.11_0: and this Mahānāma asks him a question that’s too deep.
ai-an3:73.1.12_0: Why don’t I take him off to one side and teach him the Dhamma?”
ai-an3:73.2.1_0: Then Ānanda took Mahānāma by the arm, led him off to one side, and said to him,
ai-an3:73.2.2_0: “Mahānāma, the Buddha has spoken of the ethics and immersion;
ai-an3:73.2.2_1: The Buddha said that a trainee, and immersion is also said by the Blessed One.
ai-an3:73.2.2_2: too has spoken of the Buddha spoken of the trainee by the Buddha.
ai-an3:73.2.3_0: What is the ethics of a trainee?
ai-an3:73.2.4_0: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. ...
ai-an3:73.2.4_1: trains in the training rules he has undertaken.
ai-an3:73.2.5_0: This is called the ethics of a trainee.
ai-an3:73.3.1_0: And what is the immersion of a trainee?
ai-an3:73.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption ... second absorption ... third absorption ... fourth absorption.
ai-an3:73.3.3_0: This is called the immersion of a trainee.
ai-an3:73.4.2_0: They truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:73.4.2_1: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:73.5.1_0: Then a noble disciple—accomplished in ethics, immersion, and wisdom—realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:73.5.2_0: In this way the Buddha spoke of the ethics, and the ethics of a trainee.
ai-an3:73.5.2_1: The Buddha said that a trainee, and immersion is also said by the Blessed One.
ai-an3:73.5.2_2: A trainee too has spoken of the Buddha spoken of the ethics, and wisdom of wisdom.”
ai-an3:74.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-an3:74.1.2_0: Then the Licchavis Abhaya and Paṇḍitakumāra went up to Venerable Ānanda.
ai-an3:74.1.2_1: and after approaching and worshipping venerable Ānanda, they sat down on one side.
ai-an3:74.1.2_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Ānanda:
ai-an3:74.1.3_0: “Sir, the Jain leader Nāṭaputta claims to be all-knowing and all-seeing, to know and see everything without exception, thus:
ai-an3:74.1.4_0: ‘While I was constantly and continually present to me, while walking, standing, sleeping, and waking.’
ai-an3:74.1.5_0: He advocates the elimination of past karma by mortification, and breaking the bridge by not making new karma.
ai-an3:74.1.6_0: So with the ending of karma, suffering ends; with the ending of suffering, feeling ends; and with the ending of feeling, all suffering will have been worn away.
ai-an3:74.1.7_0: This is how to go beyond suffering by means of this purification by wearing away in this very life.
ai-an3:74.1.8_0: What does the Buddha say about this?”
ai-an3:74.2.1_0: “Abhaya, these three kinds of purification by wearing away have been rightly explained by the Buddha ... in order to realize extinguishment.
ai-an3:74.2.3_0: It’s when, Abhaya, a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an3:74.2.4_0: They don’t perform any new deeds, and old deeds are eliminated by experiencing their results little by little.
ai-an3:74.2.5_0: This wearing away is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
ai-an3:74.3.1_0: Then a mendicant accomplished in ethics, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption ...
ai-an3:74.3.1_1: dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-an3:74.3.2_0: They don’t perform any new deeds, and old deeds are eliminated by experiencing their results little by little.
ai-an3:74.3.3_0: This wearing away is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
ai-an3:74.4.1_0: Then a mendicant accomplished in immersion realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:74.4.2_0: They don’t perform any new deeds, and old deeds are eliminated by experiencing their results little by little.
ai-an3:74.4.3_0: This wearing away is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
ai-an3:74.4.4_0: These are the three kinds of purification by wearing away that have been rightly explained by the Buddha ... in order to realize extinguishment.”
ai-an3:74.5.1_0: When he said this, Paṇḍitakumāra said to Abhaya,
ai-an3:74.5.2_0: “Dear Abhaya, is there anything in what Ānanda has said so well that you would disagree with?”
ai-an3:74.5.3_0: “How could I not agree with what was said so well by Ānanda?
ai-an3:74.5.4_0: If anyone didn’t applaud such fine words, Ānanda!”
ai-an3:75.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:75.2.1_0: “Ānanda, those who you have sympathy for, and those worth listening to—friends and colleagues, relatives and family—should be encouraged, supported, and established in three things.
ai-an3:75.2.4_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-an3:75.2.6_0: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’
ai-an3:75.2.8_0: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’
ai-an3:75.3.1_0: There might be change in the four primary elements—
ai-an3:75.3.2_0: earth, water, air, and fire—but a noble disciple with experiential confidence in the Buddha would never change.
ai-an3:75.3.3_0: In this context, ‘change’ means that such a noble disciple will be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm: this is not possible.
ai-an3:75.4.1_0: There might be change in the four primary elements—
ai-an3:75.4.2_0: earth, water, air, and fire—but a noble disciple with experiential confidence in the teaching ...
ai-an3:75.4.3_0: or the Saṅgha would never change.
ai-an3:75.4.4_0: In this context, ‘change’ means that such a noble disciple will be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm: this is not possible.
ai-an3:75.5.1_0: Those who you have sympathy for, and those worth listening to—friends and colleagues, relatives and family—should be encouraged, supported, and established in these three things.”
ai-an3:76.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:76.1.1_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-an3:76.1.2_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘continued existence’.
ai-an3:76.2.1_0: “If, Ānanda, there were no deeds to result in the sensual realm, would continued existence in the sensual realm still come about?”
ai-an3:76.2.3_0: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
ai-an3:76.2.4_0: The consciousness of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a lower realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
ai-an3:76.3.1_0: If there were no deeds to result in the realm of luminous form, would continued existence in the realm of luminous form still come about?”
ai-an3:76.3.3_0: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
ai-an3:76.3.4_0: The consciousness of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a middle realm.
ai-an3:76.4.1_0: If there were no deeds to result in the formless realm, would continued existence in the formless realm still come about?”
ai-an3:76.4.3_0: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
ai-an3:76.4.4_0: The consciousness of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a higher realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
ai-an3:76.4.5_0: That’s how continued existence is defined.”
ai-an3:76.4.6_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an3:77.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
ai-an3:77.1.2_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘continued existence’.
ai-an3:77.2.1_0: “If, Ānanda, there were no deeds to result in the sensual realm, would continued existence in the sensual realm still come about?”
ai-an3:77.2.3_0: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
ai-an3:77.2.4_0: The intention and aim of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a lower realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
ai-an3:77.3.1_0: If there were no deeds to result in the realm of luminous form, would continued existence in the realm of luminous form still come about?”
ai-an3:77.3.3_0: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
ai-an3:77.3.4_0: The intention and aim of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a middle realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
ai-an3:77.4.1_0: If there were no deeds to result in the formless realm, would continued existence in the formless realm still come about?”
ai-an3:77.4.3_0: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
ai-an3:77.4.4_0: The intention and aim of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a higher realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
ai-an3:77.4.5_0: That’s how continued existence is defined.”
ai-an3:78.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:78.1.2_0: “Ānanda, are all precepts and observances, lifestyles, and spiritual paths fruitful when taken as the essence?”
ai-an3:78.2.1_0: “Take the case of someone who cultivates precepts and observances, a lifestyle, and a spiritual path, taking this as the essence. If unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline, that’s not fruitful.
ai-an3:78.2.2_0: However, if unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow, that is fruitful.”
ai-an3:78.3.1_0: Then Ānanda, knowing that the teacher approved, got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-an3:78.3.2_0: Then, not long after Ānanda had left, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-an3:78.3.4_0: but it’s not easy to find his equal in wisdom.”
ai-an3:79.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:79.1.1_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-an3:79.2.1_0: “Sir, there are three kinds of fragrance that spread only with the wind, not against it.
ai-an3:79.2.3_0: The fragrance of roots, heartwood, and flowers.
ai-an3:79.2.4_0: These are the three kinds of fragrance that spread only with the wind, not against it.
ai-an3:79.2.5_0: Is there a kind of fragrance that spreads with the wind, and against it, and both?”
ai-an3:79.3.1_0: “There is, Ānanda, such a kind of fragrance.”
ai-an3:79.3.2_0: “So what, sir, is that kind of fragrance?”
ai-an3:79.4.1_0: “It’s when, Ānanda, in some village or town, a woman or man has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-an3:79.4.2_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or take alcoholic drinks that cause negligence. They’re ethical, of good character.
ai-an3:79.4.3_0: They live at home with a heart rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
ai-an3:79.5.1_0: Ascetics and brahmins everywhere praise them for these good qualities;
ai-an3:79.5.2_0: ‘In such and such a village or town, a woman or man has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-an3:79.5.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or take alcoholic drinks that cause negligence. They’re ethical, of good character.
ai-an3:79.5.4_0: They live at home with a heart rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.’
ai-an3:79.6.2_0: ‘In such and such a village or town, a woman or man has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-an3:79.6.3_1: They don’t refrain from liquor, wines, or good character.
ai-an3:79.6.4_0: They live at home with a heart rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.’
ai-an3:79.6.5_0: This is the kind of fragrance that spreads with the wind, and against it, and both.
ai-an3:79.7.1_0: The fragrance of flowers doesn’t spread upwind,
ai-an3:79.7.3_0: but the fragrance of the good spreads upwind;
ai-an3:79.7.4_0: a good person’s virtue spreads in every direction.”
ai-an3:80.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:80.1.1_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-an3:80.1.2_0: “Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-an3:80.1.3_0: ‘Ānanda, the Buddha Sikhi had a disciple called Abhibhū. Standing in the Brahmā realm, he could make his voice heard throughout the galaxy.’
ai-an3:80.1.4_0: “... I wonder how far a Blessed One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha can make their voice heard?”
ai-an3:80.1.5_0: “He was a disciple, Ānanda. Realized Ones are immeasurable.”
ai-an3:80.2.1_0: For a second time venerable Ānanda said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an3:80.2.2_0: “Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-an3:80.2.3_0: ‘Ānanda, the Buddha Sikhi had a disciple called Abhibhū. Standing in the Brahmā realm, he could make his voice heard throughout the galaxy.’
ai-an3:80.2.4_0: “... I wonder how far a Blessed One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha can make their voice heard?”
ai-an3:80.2.5_0: “He was a disciple, Ānanda. Realized Ones are immeasurable.”
ai-an3:80.3.1_0: For a third time venerable Ānanda said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an3:80.3.2_0: “Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-an3:80.3.3_0: ‘Ānanda, the Buddha Sikhi had a disciple called Abhibhū. Standing in the Brahmā realm, he could make his voice heard throughout the galaxy.’
ai-an3:80.3.4_0: “... I wonder how far a Blessed One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha can make their voice heard?”
ai-an3:80.3.5_0: “Ānanda, have you heard of a thousandfold lesser world system, a galaxy?”
ai-an3:80.3.6_0: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One.
ai-an3:80.3.7_0: Let the Buddha speak and the mendicants will remember it.”
ai-an3:80.3.8_0: “Well then, Ānanda, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an3:80.4.1_0: “Ānanda, a galaxy extends a thousand times as far as the moon and sun revolve and the shining ones light up the quarters.
ai-an3:80.4.2_0: In that galaxy there are a thousand moons, a thousand suns, a thousand Sinerus king of mountains, a thousand Indias, a thousand Western Continents, a thousand Northern Continents, a thousand Eastern Continents, four thousand oceans, four thousand Great Kings, a thousand realms of the Gods of the Four Great Kings, a thousand realms of the Gods of the Thirty-Three, of the Gods of Yama, of the Joyful Gods, of the Gods who Love to Create, of the Gods who Control the Creations of Others, and a thousand Brahmā realms.
ai-an3:80.4.3_0: is called a thousandfold lesser world system, a ‘galaxy’.
ai-an3:80.5.1_0: A world system that extends for a thousand galaxies
ai-an3:80.5.2_0: is called a millionfold middling world system, a ‘galactic cluster’.
ai-an3:80.6.1_0: A world system that extends for a thousand galactic clusters
ai-an3:80.6.2_0: is called a billionfold great world system, a ‘galactic supercluster’.
ai-an3:80.7.1_0: If he wished, Ānanda, a Realized One could make his voice heard throughout a galactic supercluster, or as far as he wants.”
ai-an3:80.8.1_0: “But how would the Buddha make his voice heard so far?”
ai-an3:80.8.2_0: “First, Ānanda, a Realized One would fill the galactic supercluster with light.
ai-an3:80.8.3_0: When sentient beings saw the light, the Realized One would project his call so that they’d hear the sound.
ai-an3:80.8.4_0: That’s how a Realized One could make his voice heard throughout a galactic supercluster, or as far as he wants.”
ai-an3:80.9.1_0: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to Venerable Udāyī,

ai-an3:89.3.3_0: This is called the training in the higher mind.

ai-an3:92.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a farmer has three urgent duties.
ai-an3:92.1.3_0: A farmer swiftly makes sure the field is well ploughed and tilled.
ai-an3:92.1.4_0: Next they swiftly plant seeds in season.
ai-an3:92.1.5_0: When the time is right, they swiftly irrigate or drain the field.
ai-an3:92.1.6_0: These are the three urgent duties of a farmer.
ai-an3:92.1.7_0: That farmer has no special power or ability to say:
ai-an3:92.1.8_0: ‘Let the crops germinate today! Let them flower tomorrow! Let them ripen the day after!’
ai-an3:92.1.9_0: There comes a time when that householder’s trunk is conceived in his womb, as well as the currents.
ai-an3:92.2.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant has three urgent duties.
ai-an3:92.2.3_0: Undertaking the training in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.
ai-an3:92.2.4_0: These are the three urgent duties of a mendicant.
ai-an3:92.2.5_0: That mendicant has no psychic power or might.

ai-an3:92.2.7_0: But there comes a time—as that mendicant trains in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom—that their mind is freed from defilements by not grasping.
ai-an3:92.3.1_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an3:92.3.2_0: ‘Our desires will be higher than the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom. It will be aroused by desire for the higher mind.’
ai-an3:93.1.1_0: “Mendicants, wanderers who follow other paths advocate three kinds of seclusion.
ai-an3:93.1.3_0: Seclusion in robes, alms-food, and lodgings.
ai-an3:93.2.1_0: Wanderers who follow other paths advocate this kind of seclusion in robes. They wear robes of sunn hemp, mixed hemp, corpse-wrapping cloth, rags, lodh tree bark, antelope hide (whole or in strips), kusa grass, bark, wood-chips, human hair, horse-tail hair, or owls’ wings.
ai-an3:93.2.2_0: This is what wanderers who follow other paths advocate for seclusion in robes.
ai-an3:93.3.1_0: Wanderers who follow other paths advocate this kind of seclusion in alms-food.
ai-an3:93.3.2_0: They eat herbs, millet, wild rice, poor rice, water lettuce, rice bran, scum from boiling rice, sesame flour, grass, or cow dung. They survive on forest roots and fruits, or eating fallen fruit.
ai-an3:93.3.3_0: This is what the wanderers who follow other paths advocate for seclusion in alms-food.
ai-an3:93.4.1_0: Wanderers who follow other paths advocate this kind of seclusion in a wilderness, the root of a tree, a hill, a ravine, a heap of straw.
ai-an3:93.4.2_0: This is what wanderers who follow other paths advocate for seclusion in lodgings.
ai-an3:93.4.3_0: These are the three kinds of seclusion that wanderers who follow other paths advocate.
ai-an3:93.5.1_0: There are these three kinds of seclusion:
ai-an3:93.5.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant is ethical, giving up unethical conduct, being secluded from it.
ai-an3:93.5.4_0: when they have right view, giving up wrong view, being secluded from it;
ai-an3:93.5.5_0: when they’ve ended defilements, giving up defilements, being secluded from them:
ai-an3:93.5.6_0: When a mendicant is ethical, giving up unethical conduct, being secluded from it;
ai-an3:93.5.7_0: when they have right view, giving up wrong view, being secluded from it;
ai-an3:93.5.8_0: when they’ve ended defilements, giving up defilements, being secluded from them:
ai-an3:93.5.9_0: they’re called a mendicant who has reached the peak and the pith, being pure and grounded in the essential.
ai-an3:93.6.1_0: When a farmer’s rice field is ripe,
ai-an3:93.6.7_0: the straw and chaff removed swiftly,
ai-an3:93.6.12_0: and have the husks removed swiftly.
ai-an3:93.6.13_0: In this way that farmer’s crop would reach the peak and the pith, being pure and consisting only of what is essential.
ai-an3:93.7.1_0: In the same way, when a mendicant is ethical, giving up unethical conduct, being secluded from it;
ai-an3:93.7.2_0: when they have right view, giving up wrong view, being secluded from it;
ai-an3:93.7.3_0: when they’ve ended defilements, giving up defilements, being secluded from them:
ai-an3:93.7.4_0: they’re called a mendicant who has reached the peak and the pith, being pure and grounded in the essential.”
ai-an3:94.1.1_0: “After the rainy season the sky is clear and cloudless. And when the sun rises, it dispels all the darkness from the sky as it shines and glows and radiates. ...”
ai-an3:94.2.1_0: In the same way, when a noble disciple stains the dust and difference between the eye, the noble ones give up three fetters:
ai-an3:94.2.2_0: embodiment view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an3:94.3.1_0: Afterwards they get rid of two things: desire and aversion.
ai-an3:94.3.2_0: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, they enter and remain in the first absorption ...
ai-an3:94.3.3_0: If that noble disciple passed away at that time, they’re bound by no fetter that might return them to this world.”
ai-an3:95.1.3_0: An assembly of the best, a divided assembly, and a harmonious assembly.
ai-an3:95.2.1_0: And what is an assembly of the best?
ai-an3:95.2.2_0: An assembly where the senior mendicants are not indulgent or slack, nor are they backsliders. Instead, they take the lead in seclusion, rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized. And those who come afterwards follow their example.
ai-an3:95.2.3_0: They too aren’t indulgent or slack ...
ai-an3:95.2.4_0: This is called an assembly of the best.
ai-an3:95.3.1_0: And what is a divided assembly?
ai-an3:95.3.2_0: An assembly where the mendicants argue, quarrel, and fight, continually wounding each other with barbed words. This is called a harmonious assembly.
ai-an3:95.4.1_0: And what is a harmonious assembly?
ai-an3:95.4.2_0: An assembly where the mendicants live in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, and regarding each other with kindly eyes. This is called a harmonious assembly.
ai-an3:95.5.1_0: When the mendicants live in harmony like this, they make much merit.
ai-an3:95.5.2_0: At that time the mendicants live in a holy dwelling, that is, the heart’s release by rejoicing.
ai-an3:95.5.3_0: When they’re joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when they’re blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.
ai-an3:95.6.1_0: It’s like when it rains heavily on a mountain top, and the water flows downhill to fill the hollows, crevices, and creeks. As they become full, they fill up the pools. The pools fill up the lakes, the lakes fill up the streams, and the streams fill up the rivers. And as the rivers become full, they fill up the ocean.
ai-an3:95.7.1_0: In the same way, when the mendicants are in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, and regarding each other with kindly eyes, they make much merit.
ai-an3:95.7.2_0: At that time the mendicants live in a holy dwelling, that is, the heart’s release by rejoicing.
ai-an3:95.7.3_0: When they’re joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when they’re blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.
ai-an3:96.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with three factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an3:96.1.3_0: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred is beautiful, strong, and fast.
ai-an3:96.1.4_0: A fine royal thoroughbred with these three factors is worthy of a king. ...
ai-an3:96.1.5_0: In the same way, a mendicant with three factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an3:96.1.7_0: It’s when a mendicant is beautiful, strong, and fast.
ai-an3:96.2.1_0: And how is a mendicant beautiful?
ai-an3:96.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an3:96.2.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is beautiful.
ai-an3:96.3.1_0: And how is a mendicant strong?
ai-an3:96.3.2_0: It’s for a mendicant who lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-an3:96.3.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is strong.
ai-an3:96.4.1_0: And how is a mendicant fast?
ai-an3:96.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ ...
ai-an3:96.4.5_0: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an3:96.4.6_0: That’s how a mendicant is fast.
ai-an3:96.4.7_0: A mendicant with these three factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”

ai-an3:99.1.3_0: Pute canvas is ugly, unpleasant to touch, and worthless whether it’s new, worn in, or worn out.

ai-an3:100.1.2_0: ‘No matter how this person performs a deed, they experience it the same way.’ This being so, the spiritual life could not be lived, and there’d be no chance of making a complete end of suffering.
ai-an3:100.1.4_0: ‘No matter how this person performs a deed, they experience the result as it should be experienced.’ This being so, the spiritual life can be lived, and there is a chance of making a complete end of suffering.
ai-an3:100.1.5_0: It’s when someone does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell.
ai-an3:100.1.6_0: Meanwhile, another person does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in the present life, without even a bit left over, not to speak of a lot. ...
ai-an3:100.2.1_0: What kind of person does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell?
ai-an3:100.2.2_0: A person who hasn’t developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, or wisdom. They’re small-minded and mean-spirited, living in suffering.
ai-an3:100.2.3_0: That kind of person does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell.
ai-an3:100.3.1_0: What kind of person does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in the present life, without even a bit left over, let alone a lot?
ai-an3:100.3.2_0: A person who has developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom. They’re not small-minded, but are big-hearted, living without limits.
ai-an3:100.3.3_0: That kind of person does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in the present life, without even a bit left over, not to speak of a lot.
ai-an3:100.4.1_0: Suppose a person was to throw a little bit of water from a time.

ai-an3:101.1.1_0: “Gold has coarse corruptions: sand, soil, and gravel.
ai-an3:101.1.2_0: A panner or their apprentice pours it into a pan, where they wash, rinse, and clean it.
ai-an3:101.1.3_0: When that’s been eliminated, there are medium corruptions in the gold: fine grit and coarse sand.
ai-an3:101.1.5_0: When that’s been eliminated, there are fine corruptions in the gold: fine sand and black grime.
ai-an3:101.1.7_0: When that’s been eliminated, only gold dust is left.
ai-an3:101.1.8_0: A goldsmith or their apprentice places the gold in a crucible where they blow, melt, and smelt it.
ai-an3:101.1.9_0: Still the gold is not settled and the dross is not totally gone. It’s not pliable, workable, or radiant, but is brittle and not completely ready for working.
ai-an3:101.1.10_0: But the goldsmith keeps on blowing, melting, and smelting it.
ai-an3:101.1.11_0: The gold becomes pliable, workable, and radiant, not brittle, and ready to be worked.
ai-an3:101.1.12_0: Then the goldsmith can successfully create any kind of ornament they want, whether a bracelet, earrings, a necklace, or a golden garland.
ai-an3:101.2.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant who is committed to the higher mind has coarse corruptions: bad bodily, verbal, and mental conduct. A sincere, capable mendicant gives these up, gets rid of, eliminates, and obliterates them.
ai-an3:101.2.2_0: When they’ve been given up and eliminated, there are middling corruptions: sensual, malicious, or cruel thoughts. A sincere, capable mendicant gives these up, gets rid of, eliminates, and obliterates them.
ai-an3:101.2.3_0: When they’ve been given up and eliminated, there are fine corruptions: thoughts of family, country, and being looked up to. A sincere, capable mendicant gives these up, gets rid of, eliminates, and obliterates them.
ai-an3:101.2.4_0: When they’ve been given up and eliminated, only thoughts about the teaching are left.
ai-an3:101.2.5_0: That immersion is not peaceful or sublime or tranquil or unified, but is held in place by forceful suppression.
ai-an3:101.2.6_0: There comes a time when the mind is stilled, settled, unified, and immersed in samādhi.
ai-an3:101.2.7_0: That immersion is peaceful and sublime and tranquil and unified, not held in place by forceful suppression.
ai-an3:101.2.8_0: They become capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which they extend the mind, in each and every case.

ai-an3:101.3.1_3: Outside the walls, (wholes) came through the air, as though he were unable to walk.
ai-an3:101.3.1_4: They could make up out of the earth, like the water in the sky.

ai-an3:101.3.1_7: even the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful!

ai-an3:101.5.15_0: and mind not immersed in samādhi as “mind not immersed in samādhi”;

ai-an3:101.6.1_1: ‘May I recollect many kinds of past lives. That is:
ai-an3:101.6.1_2: “There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-an3:101.6.1_3: They recollect many kinds of past lives, with features and details.”
ai-an3:101.6.2_0: They’re capable of realizing it, in each and every case.
ai-an3:101.7.1_1: ‘With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, may I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place—and understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds:
ai-an3:101.7.1_2: “These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an3:101.7.1_3: They spoke ill of the noble ones; they had wrong view; and they acted out of that wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. And may I understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.”
ai-an3:101.7.2_0: They’re capable of realizing it, in each and every case.
ai-an3:101.8.1_1: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an3:101.8.2_0: They’re capable of realizing it, in each and every case.”
ai-an3:102.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant committed to the higher mind should focus on three foundations from time to time:
ai-an3:102.1.2_0: the foundation of immersion, the foundation of exertion, and the foundation of equanimity. ...
ai-an3:102.1.3_0: If a mendicant dedicated to the higher mind focuses solely on the foundation of immersion, it’s likely their mind will incline to laziness.
ai-an3:102.1.4_0: If they focus solely on the foundation of exertion, it’s likely their mind will incline to restlessness.
ai-an3:102.1.5_0: If they focus solely on the foundation of equanimity, it’s likely their mind won’t properly become immersed in samādhi for the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:102.1.6_0: But when a mendicant dedicated to the higher mind focuses from time to time on the foundation of immersion, the foundation of exertion, and the foundation of equanimity, their mind becomes pliable, workable, and radiant, not brittle, and has properly entered immersion for the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:102.2.1_0: It’s like when a goldsmith or a goldsmith’s apprentice prepares a forge, fires the crucible, picks up some gold with tongs and puts it in the crucible. From time to time they fan it, from time to time they sprinkle water on it, and from time to time they just watch over it.
ai-an3:102.2.2_0: If they solely fanned it, the gold would likely be scorched.
ai-an3:102.2.3_0: If they solely sprinkled water on it, the gold would likely cool down.
ai-an3:102.2.4_0: If they solely sprinkled water on it, the gold would not blow on it.
ai-an3:102.2.5_0: But when that goldsmith fans it from time to time, sprinkles water on it from time to time, and watches over it from time to time, that gold becomes pliable, workable, and radiant, not brittle, and is ready to be worked.
ai-an3:102.2.6_0: Then the goldsmith can successfully create any kind of ornament they want, whether a bracelet, earrings, a necklace, or a golden garland.
ai-an3:102.3.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant committed to the higher mind should focus on three foundations from time to time:
ai-an3:102.3.2_0: the foundation of immersion, the foundation of exertion, and the foundation of equanimity. ...
ai-an3:102.3.3_0: If a mendicant dedicated to the higher mind focuses solely on the foundation of immersion, it’s likely their mind will incline to laziness.
ai-an3:102.3.4_0: If they focus solely on the foundation of exertion, it’s likely their mind will incline to restlessness.
ai-an3:102.3.5_0: If they focus solely on the foundation of equanimity, it’s likely their mind won’t properly become immersed in samādhi for the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:102.3.6_0: But when a mendicant dedicated to the higher mind focuses from time to time on the foundation of immersion, the foundation of exertion, and the foundation of equanimity, their mind becomes pliable, workable, and radiant, not brittle, and has properly entered immersion for the ending of defilements.
ai-an3:102.3.7_0: They become capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which they extend the mind, in each and every case.
ai-an3:102.4.1_0: If they wish: ‘May I wield the many kinds of psychic power’ ...
ai-an3:102.4.2_0: ‘With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, may I hear both kinds of sounds, human and divine, whether near or far.’ ...
ai-an3:102.4.5_0: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an3:102.4.6_0: They’re capable of realizing it, in each and every case.”

ai-an3:103.1.1_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
ai-an3:103.1.2_0: ‘What’s the gratification in the world? What’s the drawback? What’s the escape?’
ai-an3:103.1.4_0: ‘The pleasure and happiness that arise from the world: this is its gratification.
ai-an3:103.1.5_0: That the world is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-an3:103.1.6_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for the world: this is its escape.’
ai-an3:103.1.7_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-an3:103.1.8_0: But when I did truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-an3:103.1.9_0: To me knowledge and insight arose:
ai-an3:103.1.10_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-an3:104.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I went in search of the world’s gratification, and I found it.
ai-an3:104.1.2_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the gratification in the world.
ai-an3:104.1.3_0: I went in search of the world’s drawbacks, and I found them.
ai-an3:104.1.4_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the drawbacks in the world.
ai-an3:104.1.5_0: I went in search of escape from the world, and I found it.
ai-an3:104.1.6_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of escape from the world.
ai-an3:104.1.7_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-an3:104.1.8_0: But when I did truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-an3:104.1.9_0: To me knowledge and insight arose:
ai-an3:104.1.10_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-an3:105.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if there were no gratification in the world, sentient beings wouldn’t love it.
ai-an3:105.1.2_0: But because there is gratification in the world, sentient beings do love it.
ai-an3:105.1.3_0: If the world had no drawback, sentient beings wouldn’t grow disillusioned with it.
ai-an3:105.1.4_0: But since the world has a drawback, sentient beings do grow disillusioned with it.
ai-an3:105.1.5_0: If there were no escape from the world, sentient beings wouldn’t escape from it.
ai-an3:105.1.6_0: But since there is an escape from the world, sentient beings do escape from it.
ai-an3:105.1.7_0: As long as sentient beings don’t truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, they haven’t escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and they don’t live detached, liberated, with a mind free of limits.
ai-an3:105.1.8_0: But when sentient beings truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, they’ve escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and they live detached, liberated, with a mind free of limits.”
ai-an3:106.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are.
ai-an3:106.1.2_0: I don’t regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having realized it with their own insight.
ai-an3:106.1.3_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are.
ai-an3:106.1.4_0: I regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.”
ai-an3:107.1.1_0: “Singinging is regarded as wailing in the training of the Noble One.
ai-an3:107.1.3_0: What is the far shore of the Noble One?
ai-an3:107.1.4_0: So break off singing and dancing; and when you’re appropriately pleased, it’s enough to simply smile.”
ai-an3:108.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are three indulgences that never satisfy.
ai-an3:108.1.6_0: These are the three indulgences that never satisfy.”
ai-an3:108.1.7_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an3:109.1.1_0: Then he went to the Buddha,
ai-an3:109.1.1_2: While sitting on one side the Fortunate One said this to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
ai-an3:109.1.2_0: “When the mind is unprotected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are unprotected.
ai-an3:109.1.3_0: When deeds are unprotected, they become corrupted.
ai-an3:109.1.4_0: When deeds are corrupted, they become rotten.
ai-an3:109.1.5_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are rotten will not have a good death.
ai-an3:109.2.1_0: It’s like a bungalow with a bad roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are unprotected.
ai-an3:109.3.1_0: In the same way, when the mind is unprotected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are unprotected. ...
ai-an3:109.3.2_0: When deeds are unprotected, they become corrupted.
ai-an3:109.3.3_0: When deeds are corrupted, they become rotten.
ai-an3:109.3.4_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are rotten will not have a good death.
ai-an3:109.4.1_0: When the mind is protected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are protected.
ai-an3:109.4.2_0: When deeds are protected, they don’t become corrupted.
ai-an3:109.4.3_0: When deeds aren’t corrupted, they don’t become rotten.
ai-an3:109.4.4_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind aren’t rotten will have a good death.
ai-an3:109.5.1_0: It’s like a bungalow with a good roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are protected.
ai-an3:109.5.2_0: They’re not lustful, and don’t become corrupted.
ai-an3:109.6.1_0: In the same way, when the mind is protected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are protected. ...
ai-an3:109.6.2_0: When deeds are protected, they don’t become corrupted.
ai-an3:109.6.3_0: When deeds aren’t corrupted, they don’t become rotten.
ai-an3:109.6.4_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind aren’t rotten will have a good death.”
ai-an3:110.1.1_0: While sitting on one side the Fortunate One said this to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
ai-an3:110.1.2_0: “Householder, when the mind is fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are fallen.
ai-an3:110.1.3_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are fallen will not have a good death.
ai-an3:110.1.4_0: It’s like a bungalow with a bad roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls fall in.
ai-an3:110.1.5_0: In the same way, when the mind is fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are fallen.
ai-an3:110.1.6_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are fallen will not have a good death.
ai-an3:110.2.1_0: When the mind is not fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are not fallen.
ai-an3:110.2.2_0: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are not fallen will have a good death.
ai-an3:110.2.3_0: It’s like a bungalow with a good roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are not fallen in.
ai-an3:110.2.4_0: In the same way, when the mind is not fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are not fallen.
ai-an3:110.2.5_0: Their deeds of someone who has not been corrupted
ai-an3:110.2.5_1: A good person isn’t malicious, and has a good death.”
ai-an3:111.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:111.1.3_0: Greed, hate, and delusion are sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:111.1.4_0: Any deed that emerges from greed—born, sourced, and originated from greed, hate, and delusion—is called the cessation of suffering.
ai-an3:111.1.5_0: Any deed that emerges from hate—born, sourced, and originated from love—is skillful, blameless, results in suffering, and leads to the cessation of more deeds.
ai-an3:111.1.6_0: Any deed that emerges from delusion—born, sourced, and originated from delusion, sourced in deeds, and originated from that new deeds, it doesn’t lead to the cessation of suffering.
ai-an3:111.1.7_0: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:111.2.1_0: There are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:111.2.3_0: Contentment, source, origin, and condition of deeds.
ai-an3:111.2.4_0: Any deed that emerges from contentment, love, or understanding—born, sourced, and originated from contentment, love, or understanding—is skillful, blameless, results in happiness, and leads to the cessation of more deeds, not their creation.
ai-an3:111.2.5_0: Any deed that emerges from love—born, sourced, and originated from love—is skillful, blameless, results in happiness, and leads to the cessation of more deeds, not their creation.
ai-an3:111.2.6_0: Any deed that emerges from love—born, sourced, and originated from deeds, sourced, and originated from that new deeds, results in happiness, and leads to the cessation of more deeds, not their creation.
ai-an3:111.2.7_0: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.”
ai-an3:112.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:112.1.3_0: Desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.
ai-an3:112.1.4_0: In future desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present.
ai-an3:112.1.5_0: Desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present.
ai-an3:112.1.6_0: And how does desire come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present?
ai-an3:112.1.7_0: In your heart you think about and consider things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.
ai-an3:112.1.8_0: When you do this, desire comes up,
ai-an3:112.1.9_0: and you get attached to those things.
ai-an3:112.1.10_0: This lust in the heart is what I call a fetter.
ai-an3:112.1.11_0: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.
ai-an3:112.2.1_0: And how does desire come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the future?
ai-an3:112.2.2_0: In future, desire comes up, thinking,
ai-an3:112.2.3_0: When you do this, desire comes up,
ai-an3:112.2.4_0: and you get attached to those things.
ai-an3:112.2.5_0: This lust in the heart is what I call a fetter.
ai-an3:112.2.6_0: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the future.
ai-an3:112.3.1_0: And how does desire come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present?
ai-an3:112.3.2_0: In present you think about and consider things that stimulate desire and greed in the present.
ai-an3:112.3.3_0: When you do this, desire comes up,
ai-an3:112.3.4_0: and you get attached to those things.
ai-an3:112.3.5_0: This lust in the heart is what I call a fetter.
ai-an3:112.3.6_0: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present.
ai-an3:112.3.7_0: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:112.4.1_0: There are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
ai-an3:112.4.3_0: Desire doesn’t come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.
ai-an3:112.4.4_0: Desire doesn’t come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the future.
ai-an3:112.4.5_0: Desire doesn’t come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present.
ai-an3:112.5.1_0: And how does desire not come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present?
ai-an3:112.5.2_0: You understand the future result of things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.
ai-an3:112.5.3_0: When you know this, you grow disillusioned,
ai-an3:112.5.4_0: your heart becomes dispassionate, and you see it with penetrating wisdom.
ai-an3:112.5.5_0: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.
ai-an3:112.6.1_0: And how does desire not come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the future?
ai-an3:112.6.2_0: You understand the future result of things that stimulate desire and greed in the future.
ai-an3:112.6.3_0: When you know this, you grow disillusioned,
ai-an3:112.6.4_0: your heart becomes dispassionate, and you see it with penetrating wisdom.
ai-an3:112.6.5_0: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the future.
ai-an3:112.7.1_0: And how does desire not come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present?
ai-an3:112.7.2_0: When you understand the future results in future results, you see the future results in future, and have comprehended them with wisdom, you see with penetrating wisdom.
ai-an3:112.7.3_0: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the present.
ai-an3:112.7.4_0: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.”
ai-an3:112.7.6_0: The first sub-chapter on mouthfuls is finished.
ai-an3:112.8.2_0: The ascetic, the fifth simile of the ascetic,
ai-an3:113.1.1_0: “Mendicants, three kinds of people are bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.
ai-an3:113.1.3_0: There whoever is not celibate, who lives the spiritual life,
ai-an3:113.1.4_0: someone who makes a groundless accusation of unchastity against a person whose celibacy is pure;
ai-an3:113.1.5_0: and someone who has the view, ‘There is nothing wrong with sensual pleasures,’ so they throw themselves into sensual pleasures.
ai-an3:113.1.6_0: These are the three kinds of people bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.”
ai-an3:114.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the appearance of three people is rare in the world.
ai-an3:114.1.3_0: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. A person who teaches the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One. A person who is grateful and thankful.
ai-an3:114.1.4_0: The appearance of these three people is rare in the world.”
ai-an3:115.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:115.1.3_0: Someone easy to measure, someone hard to measure, and someone who is immeasurable.
ai-an3:115.1.4_0: And who is the person easy to measure?
ai-an3:115.1.5_0: It’s a person who is restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying mind and undisciplined faculties.
ai-an3:115.1.6_0: This is called ‘a person easy to measure’.
ai-an3:115.2.1_0: And who is the person hard to measure?
ai-an3:115.2.2_0: It’s a person who is not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, or loose-tongued, but has established mindfulness, situational awareness and immersion, with unified mind and restrained faculties.
ai-an3:115.2.3_0: This is called ‘a person hard to measure’.
ai-an3:115.3.1_0: And who is the person hard to measure?
ai-an3:115.3.2_0: It’s a mendicant who is perfected, and has ended defilements.
ai-an3:115.3.3_0: This is called ‘a person hard to measure’.
ai-an3:115.3.4_0: These are the three people found in the world.”
ai-an3:116.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:116.1.3_0: First, a person, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-an3:116.1.4_0: They enjoy it and like it and find it satisfying. If they’re set on that, committed to it, and meditate on it often without losing it, when they die they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the dimension of infinite space.
ai-an3:116.1.5_0: The lifespan of the gods of infinite space is twenty thousand eons.
ai-an3:116.1.6_0: An ordinary person stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they go to hell or the animal realm or the ghost realm.
ai-an3:116.1.7_0: But a disciple of the Buddha stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they’re extinguished in that very life.
ai-an3:116.1.8_0: This is the difference between an educated noble disciple and an uneducated ordinary person as regards their place of rebirth.
ai-an3:116.2.1_0: Furthermore, a person, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness.

ai-an3:116.2.5_0: But a disciple of the Buddha stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they’re extinguished in that very life.

ai-an3:116.3.7_0: These are the three people found in the world.”

ai-an3:120.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these three kinds of purity.

ai-an3:122.1.4_0: And what is sagacity of body?

ai-an3:122.3.1_0: And what is sagacity of mind?

ai-an3:122.3.4_0: These are the three kinds of sagacity.

ai-an3:123.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kusināra, in the Forest of Offerings.
ai-an3:123.2.1_0: “Mendicants, take the case of a mendicant living supported by a town or village.
ai-an3:123.2.2_0: A householder or their child approaches and invites them for the next day’s meal.
ai-an3:123.2.3_0: The mendicant accepts if they want.
ai-an3:123.2.4_0: When the night has passed, they robe up in the morning, take their bowl and robe, and approach that householder’s home.
ai-an3:123.2.4_1: and after approaching he sits down on the seat.
ai-an3:123.2.5_0: The householder or their child serves and satisfies them with their own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-an3:123.3.2_0: ‘It’s so good that the householder or their child serves and satisfies me with their own hands with a variety of delicious foods.’
ai-an3:123.3.4_0: ‘I really hope this householder serves me with a variety of delicious foods in the future, too.’
ai-an3:123.3.5_0: They eat that food tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.
ai-an3:123.3.6_0: They think about it with sensual, malicious, or cruel thoughts.
ai-an3:123.3.7_0: A gift to such a mendicant is not very fruitful, I say.

ai-an3:126.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans when he arrived at Kapilavatthu.
ai-an3:126.1.2_0: Mahānāma the Sakyan heard that he had arrived.
ai-an3:126.1.3_0: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:126.1.3_1: and after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, he stood on one side.
ai-an3:126.2.1_0: “Go, Mahānāma, and set out from Kapilavatthu for you to know the night.”
ai-an3:126.2.2_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He returned to Kapilavatthu and searched all over the city, but he couldn’t see a suitable guest house for the Buddha to spend the night.
ai-an3:126.3.1_0: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha, and said to him,
ai-an3:126.3.2_0: “Sir, there’s no suitable guest house in Kapilavatthu for you to spend the night.
ai-an3:126.3.3_0: But there is this Bharaṇḍu the Kālāma, who used to be the Buddha’s spiritual companion.
ai-an3:126.3.4_0: Why don’t you spend the night at his hermitage?”
ai-an3:126.3.5_0: “Go, Mahānāma, and set out a mat.”
ai-an3:126.3.6_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage.
ai-an3:126.3.6_1: and after approaching and setting out water for washing the feet, he went to the Buddha.
ai-an3:126.3.6_2: and after going, he said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an3:126.3.7_0: “The mat and foot-washing water are set out.
ai-an3:126.3.8_0: adding, “Sir, please come at your convenience.”
ai-an3:126.4.1_0: Then the Fortunate One approached Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage.
ai-an3:126.4.1_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-an3:126.4.4_0: “It’s too late to pay homage to the Buddha.
ai-an3:126.4.6_0: Tomorrow I’ll pay homage to the Buddha.” He bowed to the Buddha and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, then he left.

ai-an3:126.5.1_1: and after approaching he sat down on one side.

ai-an3:127.2.3_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Hatthaka. He manifested in a solid life-form, bowed to the Buddha, and stood to one side.
ai-an3:127.3.1_0: “Householder, when those things were rehearsed as a human being, would these things just now?”
ai-an3:127.3.2_0: “I still rehearse now the teachings that I rehearsed as a human being.
ai-an3:127.3.3_0: I still rehearse now the teachings that I had not been reborn as a human being.
ai-an3:127.3.4_0: Just as the Buddha these days lives crowded by monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen; by rulers and their ministers, and teachers of other paths and their disciples,
ai-an3:127.3.5_0: so I live crowded by the gods.
ai-an3:127.3.6_0: The gods come from far away, thinking, ‘We’ll hear the teaching in the presence of Hatthaka.’
ai-an3:127.3.7_0: Sir, I passed away without getting enough of three things.
ai-an3:127.3.12_0: I passed away without getting enough of these three things.
ai-an3:127.4.4_0: They listen to the true teaching

ai-an3:127.5.3_0: three things have not yet become clear,
ai-an3:127.5.4_0: without getting enough of these three things.”
ai-an3:128.1.1_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling near Bārāṇasī in the Deer Park at Isipatana.
ai-an3:128.1.2_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Benares for alms.
ai-an3:128.1.3_0: The Buddha saw him wandering indiscriminately for alms-food, he saw a certain mendicant lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying mind and undisciplined faculties.
ai-an3:128.2.2_0: If you’re bitter, corrupted by carrion, flies will, without a doubt, plague and infest you.”
ai-an3:128.2.3_0: Hearing this advice of the Buddha, that monk was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-an3:128.2.4_0: Then, after the meal, on his return from alms-round, the Buddha told the mendicants what had happened. ...
ai-an3:128.3.1_0: “Mendicants, I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Benares for alms.
ai-an3:128.3.2_0: I saw a certain mendicant wandering indiscriminately for alms-food. They’re unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying mind and undisciplined faculties.

ai-an3:129.1.1_0: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha,
ai-an3:129.1.1_2: While sitting on one side venerable Anuruddha said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an3:129.1.2_0: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that females—when their body breaks up, after death—are mostly reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an3:129.1.3_0: How many qualities do females have so that they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
ai-an3:129.2.1_0: “When females have three qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an3:129.2.3_0: It’s when she lives at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
ai-an3:129.2.4_0: When females have these three qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
ai-an3:130.1.1_0: Then Venerable Anuruddha went to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an3:130.1.1_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an3:130.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an3:130.1.3_0: “Here’s the thing, Reverend Sāriputta. With clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human, I survey the entire galaxy.
ai-an3:130.1.4_0: My energy is roused up and unflagging, my mindfulness is established and lucid, my body is tranquil and undisturbed, and my mind is immersed in samādhi.
ai-an3:130.1.5_0: Yet my mind is not freed from the defilements by not grasping!”
ai-an3:130.2.2_0: ‘With clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human, I survey the entire galaxy,’ that’s your conceit.
ai-an3:130.2.4_0: ‘My energy is roused up and unflagging, my mindfulness is established and lucid, my body is tranquil and undisturbed, and my mind is immersed in samādhi,’ that’s your restlessness.
ai-an3:130.2.6_0: ‘But my mind is not freed from the defilements by not grasping,’ that’s your remorse.
ai-an3:130.2.7_0: It would be good to give up these three things. Instead of focusing on them, apply your mind to the deathless.”
ai-an3:130.3.1_0: After some time Anuruddha gave up these three things. Instead of focusing on them, he applied his mind to the deathless.
ai-an3:130.3.2_0: Then Anuruddha, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an3:130.3.3_0: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-an3:130.3.4_0: And Venerable Anuruddha became one of the perfected.
ai-an3:131.1.1_0: “Mendicants, three things are conveyed under cover, not in the open.
ai-an3:131.1.3_0: Females are married with a veil, not unveiled.
ai-an3:131.1.4_0: Brahmin hymns are conveyed under cover, not openly.
ai-an3:131.1.5_0: Wrong view is conveyed under cover, not in the open.
ai-an3:131.1.6_0: These three things are conveyed under cover, not in the open.
ai-an3:131.2.1_0: Three things shine in the open, not under cover.
ai-an3:131.2.3_0: The moon shines in the open, not under cover.
ai-an3:131.2.4_0: The sun shines in the open, not under cover.
ai-an3:131.2.5_0: The teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One shine in the open, not under cover.
ai-an3:131.2.6_0: These three things shine in the open, not under cover.”
ai-an3:132.1.1_0: “These three people are found in the world.
ai-an3:132.1.3_0: A person like a line drawn in stone, a person like a line drawn in sand, and a person like a line drawn in water.
ai-an3:132.1.4_0: And who is the person like a line drawn in stone?
ai-an3:132.1.5_0: It’s when a person is often angry,
ai-an3:132.1.6_0: but their anger lingers for a long time.
ai-an3:132.1.7_0: It’s like a line drawn in stone, which isn’t quickly worn away by wind and water, but lasts for a long time.
ai-an3:132.1.8_0: In the same way, this person is often angry,
ai-an3:132.1.9_0: but their anger lingers for a long time.
ai-an3:132.1.10_0: This is called a person like a line drawn in stone.
ai-an3:132.2.1_0: And who is the person like a line drawn in sand?
ai-an3:132.2.2_0: It’s when a person is often angry,
ai-an3:132.2.3_0: but their anger doesn’t linger long.
ai-an3:132.2.4_0: It’s like a line drawn in sand, which is quickly worn away by wind and water, and doesn’t last long.
ai-an3:132.2.5_0: In the same way, this person is often angry,
ai-an3:132.2.6_0: but their anger doesn’t linger long.
ai-an3:132.2.7_0: This is called a person like a line drawn in sand.
ai-an3:132.3.1_0: And who is the person like a line drawn in water?
ai-an3:132.3.2_0: It’s a person who, though spoken to by someone in a rough, harsh, and disagreeable manner, still stays in touch, interacts with, and greets them.
ai-an3:132.3.3_0: It’s like a line drawn in water which it doesn’t last long.
ai-an3:132.3.4_0: In the same way, a person who, though spoken to by someone in a rough, harsh, and disagreeable manner, still stays in touch, interacts with, and greets them.
ai-an3:132.3.5_0: This is called a person like a line drawn in water.
ai-an3:132.3.6_0: These are the three people found in the world.”

ai-an3:133.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a warrior with three factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an3:133.1.3_0: He’s a long-distance shooter, a marksman, one who shatters large objects.
ai-an3:133.1.4_0: A warrior with these three factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.

ai-an3:133.1.7_0: They’re a long-distance shooter, a marksman, and one who shatters large objects.
